title: Ghost of Yotei Praised in Japan for How Quintessentially Hokkaido It Feels
body_text: Related reads:Ghost of Yotei: How to Get the Armor of the Undying (Best Early Game Armor) Released on October 2, Ghost of Yotei is quickly garnering praise from Japanese gamers who are busy exploring Sucker Punchâ€™s depiction of 1600s Japan. Its choice of setting, picturesque scenery, and expansive map seem to be resonating with local residents, with the developers receiving plaudits for their detailed research and sense of style.Sucker Punchâ€™s standalone sequel to 2020â€™s award-winning Ghost of Tsushima moves the action to Ezo on Japanâ€™s northernmost main island of Hokkaido. You play as Atsu, a warrior on a quest to take vengeance on the six men who slaughtered her family.Overall, Ghost of Yoteiâ€™s scenery is getting a lot of praise from Japanese speaking commenters for its beauty, especially the titular Mount Yotei. However, one commenter, who apparently lives in Hokkaido, shared a photo of the real Mount Yotei, saying: â€œYou were probably thinking they exaggerated its beauty for the game, right? But Mount Yotei really is a beautiful mountain. Please come and visit.â€In a follow-up post, they added that the developersâ€™ decision to choose â€œMount Yotei instead of (Hokkaidoâ€™s highest mountain) Daisetsuzan makes so much sense as a person born and raised in Hokkaido. Mount Yotei isnâ€™t part of a mountain range, it stands alone, and thatâ€™s what gives it the â€˜wowâ€™ factor.â€#ã‚´ãƒ¼ã‚¹ãƒˆã‚ªãƒ–ãƒ¨ã‚¦ãƒ†ã‚¤ ã€åŒ—æµ·é“ã§ä¸€ç•ªé«˜ã„å±±ã¯å¤§é›ªå±±ãªã‚“ã ã‘ã©ã€å¤§é›ªå±±ã˜ã‚ƒãªãã¦ç¾Šè¹„å±±ã‚’é¸ã‚“ã ã®ã€é“ç”£å­ã¨ã—ã¦ã‚ã¡ã‚ƒãã¡ã‚ƒã‚ˆãã‚ã‹ã‚‹ã€‚ç¾Šè¹„å±±ã£ã¦å±±è„ˆã®ä¸­ã«ã‚ã‚‹å±±ã˜ã‚ƒãªãã¦ã½ã¤ã‚“ã¨ãã³ãˆãŸã£ã¦ã„ã¦ã€ãã‚ŒãŒã€Œã†ã‚ã‚ã€ã£ã¦ãªã‚‹ã‚“ã ã‚ˆã­ã€‚ pic.twitter.com/CRKpybvzLUâ€” â­•ï¸ã‚Šãªã‚“ã”â­•ï¸ (@rina_asami_w) October 2, 2025 The view from the mountain in-game is also getting some love for being extremely beautiful, with one user sharing screenshots.ç¾Šè¹„å±±ã‹ã‚‰ã®æ™¯è‰²ãƒãƒã‚¯ã‚½ç¶ºéº—ãªã‚“ã‚ˆãªã#GhostofYotei #ã‚´ãƒ¼ã‚¹ãƒˆã‚ªãƒ–ãƒ¨ã‚¦ãƒ†ã‚¤ pic.twitter.com/KBskFi6g2wâ€” æ‚ ä»‹äºŒå¼/? (@YusukeORTtype2) October 6, 2025 Sharing an in-game screenshot featuring Mount Yotei, another user commented: â€œI live in Ezo but Ghost of Yotei is way more quintessentially Hokkaido than I could have imagined, lol. (...) Whether it is to scale or not, the fact that the entire map is Hokkaido is deeply moving.â€è¦å¤·åœ°åœ¨ä½ã®è€…ã ã‘ã©ã€ãƒ¨ã‚¦ãƒ†ã‚¤ãŒæƒ³åƒä»¥ä¸Šã«åŒ—æµ·é“ã™ãã¦ã‚ã‚ã¦ã‚‹æƒ…å ±ã‚ã‚“ã¾ã‚Šè¿½ã£ã¦ãªã„ã‹ã‚‰çŸ¥ã‚‰ãªã‹ã£ãŸã‘ã©ã€å®Ÿéš›ã®ã‚¹ã‚±ãƒ¼ãƒ«ã¯ã¨ã‚‚ã‹ãå…¨ä½“ãƒãƒƒãƒ—ãŒåŒ—æµ·é“ãã®ã¾ã‚“ã¾ãªã®ã‚‚æ„Ÿæ…¨æ·±ã„?#ã‚´ãƒ¼ã‚¹ãƒˆã‚ªãƒ–ãƒ¨ã‚¦ãƒ†ã‚¤ pic.twitter.com/EjRvQwye1xâ€” ã¶ã£ã¡? (@ngo_nyanko) October 1, 2025 As a sidenote, map software company Zenrin got into the Ghost of Yotei spirit by sharing a real-life map of Ezo on its official X account to mark the gameâ€™s release.ç‰¹ã«æ·±ã„æ„å‘³ã¯ã‚ã‚Šã¾ã›ã‚“ãŒã€ã“ã¡ã‚‰ã¯åŒ—æµ·é“ã®ç¾Šè¹„å±±å‘¨è¾ºã®åœ°å›³ã§ã™ã€‚ pic.twitter.com/r0hAZPnhdoâ€” æ ªå¼ä¼šç¤¾ã‚¼ãƒ³ãƒªãƒ³ (@ZENRIN_official) October 1, 2025 Although Atsuâ€™s story is serious, like in Ghost of Tsushima the game also gives the player plenty of opportunities to explore the beautiful landscapes, relax in hotsprings and interact with local fauna, such as foxes. Many Japanese comments point out how â€œcuteâ€ these animals and their movements are, such as the foxâ€™s butt-wiggle reaction to your attempts to slice through bamboo, and the appearance of the Japanese long tailed tit, with users sharing a screenshot of the white bird perching on Atsuâ€™s hand. ã‚·ãƒã‚¨ãƒŠã‚¬æ¥ã¦ãã‚Œã‚‹ã®ï¼ï¼Ÿã‹ã‚ã„ã„ï¼#GhostofYotei#ã‚´ãƒ¼ã‚¹ãƒˆã‚ªãƒ–ãƒ¨ã‚¦ãƒ†ã‚¤ pic.twitter.com/3kjb2N2ciZâ€” ã½ã½ãŸ (@popo_ta9568) October 2, 2025 However, as cute as these animals might be, one user warned players that petting foxes like Atsu can do is not a good idea in real life, as although it wasnâ€™t an issue in the 1600s, the foxes in Hokkaido nowadays carry the parasitic disease echinococcosis, which can be passed to humans.Ghost of Yoteiâ€™s opening title movie, which follows Atsu riding through the landscape at speed, also gained much praise and shares, with one Japanese language comment going so far as to say: â€œAs expected, this gameâ€™s opening movie has surpassed all others.â€ Talking about the opening, another commenter added: â€œYouâ€™re galloping up the hill and then boom, Mt Yotei appears at its most beautiful. I take my hat off to the staff of Sucker Punch for their good taste and successful research. They really know how to hit the right note for Japanese audiences.â€ Others praised translation and voice acting aspects, saying that Ghost of Yotei has a â€œperfect localization for Japan.â€During the making of Ghost of Yotei, the developers took many research trips to Japan. Director Nate Fox previously talked about the teamâ€™s commitment to creating a respectful representation of Japan to match Sucker Punch's previous work on Ghost of Tsushima. In fact, Fox and Jason Connel were made permanent tourism ambassadors to the real-life Tsushima in recognition of how Ghost of Tsushima has spread awareness of the place. As more people experience Ghost of Yotei, it will be interesting to see if it gets similar recognition.Verity Townsend is a Japan-based freelance writer who previously served as editor, contributor and translator for the game news site Automaton West. She has also written about Japanese culture and movies for various publications. Related reads:Ghost of Yotei - PS5 vs PS5 Pro Graphics Comparison | 4K 60 FPS

title: Microsoft Confirms It Scrapped the Xbox Game Pass Discount on All Games and DLC Purchases, Gives Subscribers More Rewards Points Instead
body_text: Related reads:After the Week Microsoft Had You'd Be Forgiven for Believing a Rumor That Xbox Had Canceled Its Next-Gen Hardware Plans, but the Company Insists It's False Microsoft has confirmed it has scrapped the Xbox Game Pass discount on DLC purchases. Instead, itâ€™s giving subscribers more points for use in its Rewards scheme.Last week, as part of controversial changes made to Xbox Game Pass, Microsoft was found to have pulled the 10% discount on DLC for Game Pass games that Ultimate subscribers were able to get, seemingly in favor of its new Rewards scheme.The news first emerged when the Call of Duty community noticed that Ultimate subscribers were no longer eligible for 10% off COD Points purchases as well as Blackcell, the more expensive version of Call of Dutyâ€™s battle pass that can only be bought directly with real world money for $29.99. The discount was seen as highly valuable for fans who play Call of Duty via Game Pass.But fans discovered that the discount removal extended beyond Call of Duty to encompass the majority of individual DLC packs for Game Pass games. None of this was mentioned in last weekâ€™s Ultimate subscription price rise announcement.Microsoft has now issued IGN a statement confirming the change and pointing subscribers to its official website for more information.â€œThis is not specific to any one game and reflects all games and DLC purchases. Instead of a discount on the purchases, Ultimate and Premium subscribers will earn 10% and 5% â€” respectively â€” in points when purchasing select games and add-ons from the Game Pass library. Ultimate members continue to have 20% discount on select games from the Game Pass library. On top of that, all Rewards members will earn points when shopping games and add-ons on the Store, while Premium and Ultimate subscribers will earn even more, 2x and 4x respectively. See more detail on the Game Pass Rewards program here.â€Clearly, Microsoftâ€™s play here, like so many retailers, is to keep your money swirling around its ecosystem rather than your bank account. Microsoft wants its customers to spend the full amount, and will then give the saving back to them in Reward points so they can in turn spend those on gift cards, keeping the cash in the Xbox ecosystem rather than letting customers save their own money.Itâ€™s the latest development in what has been a bruising week for Microsoftâ€™s Game Pass, which kicked off with a backlash over Microsoft's decision to raise the price of Xbox Game Pass Ultimate from $19.99 a month to $29.99 a month (an extra $120 a year).To justify the increase in price of Ultimate, Microsoft has increased the number of day one releases per year to 75, and has added Fortnite Crew and Ubisoft+ Classics for the first time ever. There are also upgrades to Xbox Cloud Gaming streaming quality.Ubisoft+ Classics â€” valued at $7.99 / Â£6.99 per month per platform â€” is now part of Ultimate. Starting November 18, Fortnite Crew â€” which itself costs $11.99 / Â£9.99 a month â€” will be included in Ultimate, with access to the Fortnite Battle Pass and 1,000 V-Bucks each month.The cloud gaming boost amounts to better performance. Ultimate subscribers â€œexclusively enjoy our best quality streaming and shortest wait times,â€ Microsoft said. Xbox Cloud Gaming has also officially exited beta â€œas part of our commitment to make gameplay smoother and more responsive.â€Microsoft said the new $30 a month Ultimate price reflects â€œthe expanded catalog, new partner benefits, and upgraded cloud gaming experience.â€The new Premium tier (what was called Standard) will add new Xbox-published games within a year of their launch, but that excludes Call of Duty games. This means that if you want to play Call of Duty via Game Pass in a timely fashion, youâ€™re pretty much forced into paying for Ultimate. Over the course of a year, thatâ€™s $360. And now, you donâ€™t even get 10% off COD Points or BlackCell.Fans are running the numbers and reassessing whether Game Pass remains right for them. Black Ops 7, which just launched in beta form ahead of its November release date, is a $70 game (Microsoft backtracked on $80 after a gamer outcry at the cost of Obsidianâ€™s The Outer Worlds 2). IGNâ€™s poll on the issue, which now has over 32,000 voters, shows 53.2% of our audience will not subscribe to Game Pass at all. 20.7% said they were going for Ultimate despite the price rise.Photo by Mateusz Slodkowski/SOPA Images/LightRocket via Getty Images.Wesley is Director, News at IGN. Find him on Twitter at @wyp100. You can reach Wesley at wesley_yinpoole@ign.com or confidentially at wyp100@proton.me. Related reads:Microsoft Appears to Have Quietly Ditched the 10% Xbox Game Pass DLC Discount â€” Including for COD Points â€” This Week

title: Voldsom strid om Dar Salim-film
author: Af Frederik Hoff og Claus Christensen
body_text: Du er her: Artikler | Nyhed | Voldsom strid om Dar Salim-film RSS-feed / artikler Nyhed 02. okt. 2025 | 22:59 - Opdateret 03. okt. 2025 | 16:09 Voldsom strid om Dar Salim-film Foto | Beo Starling IfÃ¸lge Dar Salim er rollen som traumatiseret ekssoldat i Herkules falder hans bedste prÃ¦station, men nu er han havnet i et bittert opgÃ¸r med instruktÃ¸ren og hans fagforening. Spillefilmdebutanten Christian Holten Bonke anklager hovedrolleindehaveren i Herkules falder for at true sig til en bedre kreditering, mens Dar Salim mener, at Bonke forsÃ¸ger at dÃ¦kke over sin egen inkompetence. Af Frederik Hoff og Claus Christensen 5. september bragte Ekko en artikel om traileren til den kommende film Herkules falder. Dar Salim spiller hovedrollen som ekssoldaten, der kÃ¦mper med traumer og identitetsforvirring pÃ¥ et veterancenter pÃ¥ StrynÃ¸. Filmen fÃ¥r premiere 20. november og er den fÃ¸rste fiktionsfilm instrueret af dokumentaristen Christian Holten Bonke. Den har et budget pÃ¥ tretten millioner kroner, heraf ti millioner fra Det Danske Filminstitut og FilmFyn. Annonce Da traileren blev sendt ud, fremgik det ogsÃ¥ af pressemeddelelsen, at Dar Salim havde deltaget i instruktionen som â€medinstruktÃ¸r pÃ¥ setâ€ â€“ en usÃ¦dvanlig titel, der mÃ¥tte betyde, at Dar Salim havde deltaget i instruktÃ¸rarbejdet pÃ¥ optagelserne, men ikke i forarbejdet og klipningen. Netop Dar Salims kreditering har vist sig at vÃ¦re genstand for en dramatisk konflikt mellem skuespilleren og Christian Holten Bonke. Uenighed om krediteringer er almindeligt i filmbranchen, men sjÃ¦ldent en pressesag, fordi alle parter ved, at sÃ¥danne konflikter i sidste ende skader filmen. Det er imidlertid prÃ¦cis, hvad der er sket for Herkules falder. Blot halvanden mÃ¥ned inden premieren er filmen endt i et sandt clusterfuck, og det ironiske er, at den efter sigende er blevet temmelig vellykket. I gÃ¥r kunne Weekendavisen nemlig afslÃ¸re, at instruktÃ¸ren igennem fagforeningen Danske FilminstruktÃ¸rer har anklaget Dar Salim for at nedbryde ham psykisk og bruge trusler og afpresning til at tilkÃ¦mpe sig en bedre kreditering. Salim afviser anklagerne over for Weekendavisen og beskylder til gengÃ¦ld Bonke for at konstruere en krÃ¦nkelsessag. Skuespilleren mener, at han fik en stÃ¸rre ledelsesrolle som resultat af Bonkes manglende styring med produktionen. Weekendavisens kilder fra optagelserne i august 2024 â€“ inklusive af lederne af det virkelige veterancenter, hvor filmen er optaget, Anne-Line Ussing â€“ bakker op om Dar Salims oplevelse og afviser, at Salim skal have opfÃ¸rt sig dÃ¥rligt under produktionen. TÃ¥get proces 52-Ã¥rige Christian Holten Bonke blev uddannet tv-producer fra Den Danske Filmskolen i 2005. Ekko udgav pÃ¥ dvd #26 hans dansefilm Ballroom Dancer (2011), der blev udtaget til flere festivaler og fik en speciel mention i Tribeca. Han stÃ¥r desuden bag portrÃ¦tfilm om Uffe ElbÃ¦k (Uffes alternativ) og forfatteren Jakob Ejersbo (Ejersbo) og var instruktÃ¸rassistent pÃ¥ Afdeling Q-spillefilmen Marco effekten. Men det har Ã¥benbart ikke vÃ¦ret nok forberedelse til at stÃ¥ i spidsen for en spillefilm. Bonke skrev manuskriptet til Herkules falder sammen med Marianne Lentz, men i en mail, som Weekendavisen har set, erkender han, at instruktÃ¸rarbejdet var vanskeligt. Specielt undervurderede han opgaven med personinstruktion. Virkelige veteraner og ledere af StrynÃ¸-centret er en del af castet, og ifÃ¸lge en af veteranerne kom Salim til at stÃ¥ for instruktionen af dem. Efter nogle dage Ã¸nskede Dar Salim at fÃ¥ en kreditering, og der blev fundet den usÃ¦dvanlige lÃ¸sning at kreditere ham som â€medinstruktÃ¸r pÃ¥ setâ€. Salim afviser over for Ekko at skulle have truet med at forlade produktionen, og skuespilleren mener, at der var en sÃ¦rdeles god stemning pÃ¥ produktionen. IfÃ¸lge Weekendavisen opstod problemerne da ogsÃ¥ fÃ¸rst under klipningen, hvor Dar Salim sendte noter til instruktÃ¸ren og klipperen Denniz GÃ¶l Bertelsen â€“ ifÃ¸lge Salim pÃ¥ opfordring fra bÃ¥de instruktÃ¸ren og producenten. Det er i sig selv atypisk, at en skuespiller fÃ¥r lov at blande sig sÃ¥ meget i klipningen. Men ifÃ¸lge Weekendavisen ender det med, at Salim fÃ¥r stor indflydelse â€“ ogsÃ¥ pÃ¥ Ã¦ndringen af slutningen. En af de involverede skriver en mail om, at der mangler kommunikation fra bÃ¥de producenten og instruktÃ¸ren i en tÃ¥get proces, hvor alle mister tilliden til hinanden. Ydmyget offentligt Dar Salim bliver ikke betalt for sit ekstraarbejde, og derfor skriver han 5. marts en mail til Christian Holten Bonke. Han beder om en krediteringsmÃ¦ssig anerkendelse af sin rolle i filmens tilblivelse og anfÃ¦gter Bonkes instruktÃ¸revner. â€Din forestilling om, hvad det vil sige at lave en film, fortÃ¦lle en historie og at instruere stemte ikke overens med virkeligheden og de fÃ¦rdigheder og evner, det krÃ¦ver. Ikke engang tÃ¦t pÃ¥,â€ skriver skuespilleren ifÃ¸lge Weekendavisen. InstruktÃ¸ren accepterer fÃ¸rst at kalde filmen â€en film af Christian Holten Bonke og Dar Salimâ€, men Danske FilminstruktÃ¸rers chefjurist skriver senere pÃ¥ mÃ¥neden til producenten, at aftalen er droppet. IfÃ¸lge Weekendavisen mener juristen, at Salim via sin stjernestatus â€har kunnet true en debuterende fiktionsinstruktÃ¸r til at fÃ¥ instruktionskrediteringer ved kontinuerligt at nedbryde ham psykiskâ€. Salim skal have truet med at ydmyge Bonke offentligt og nÃ¦gte at mÃ¸de op til ekstraindspilninger af lyd, hvis han ikke fik det, som han Ã¸nskede. Chefjuristen skriver, at Salim ogsÃ¥ truede sig ind i klipperummet. Danske FilminstruktÃ¸rer indleder derfor en sag om dÃ¥rligt psykisk arbejdsmiljÃ¸ mod filmens producent Beo Starling, der er ejet halvt af Amalie Lyngbo Quist og halvt af Beofilm ved Peter Hyldahl. Fagforeningen opfordrer til en undersÃ¸gelse af arbejdsmiljÃ¸et pÃ¥ produktionen, og Dansk Skuespillerforbund har hyret en ekstern advokat, der arbejder pÃ¥ en undersÃ¸gelse. Dansk Skuespillerforbund, Producentforeningen og Danske FilminstruktÃ¸rer har afholdt flere mÃ¸der om sagen, men uden at kunne lÃ¸se konflikten, som dermed har udviklet sig til en stÃ¸rre skala. Chokeret over mailDar Salim siger til Ekko, at krediteringen ikke lÃ¦ngere havde nogen betydning for ham, da han kom i besiddelse af mailen fra Danske FilminstruktÃ¸rer. Han blev chokeret over anklagen om psykisk krÃ¦nkelse. Men striden er ikke blevet bilagt, og der har pÃ¥ det seneste vÃ¦ret en konflikt om stÃ¸rrelsen pÃ¥ instruktÃ¸ren og hovedrolleindehaverens navn pÃ¥ plakaten. Dar Salim mener dog ikke, at den hÃ¥rde formulering i hans mail til Bonke er retvisende for resten af hans dialog med instruktÃ¸ren. Og han er selv meget stolt af Herkules falder. â€Det er efter min mening den bedste film, jeg har medvirket i, og jeg glÃ¦der mig til at dele den med publikum. Veteranernes historie er stÃ¦rk, rÃ¸rende og relevant. Den nÃ¦gtede jeg at smide pÃ¥ gulvet. Hvis jeg stod i situationen igen, ville jeg gÃ¸re prÃ¦cis det samme Ã©n gang til â€“ uden at Ã¦ndre noget som helst.â€ GrÃ¦nseoverskridende adfÃ¦rd Ekko har forsÃ¸gt at fÃ¥ en kommentar fra Christian Holten Bonke, som ikke er vendt tilbage. Til Weekendavisen skriver han, at han stÃ¥r ved sin oplevelse. â€Meget fÃ¥ har haft indsigt i, hvordan mit samarbejde med Dar Salim reelt har vÃ¦ret bag kulisserne,â€ skriver han, men roser ogsÃ¥ Salim for en â€sublim prÃ¦stationâ€ i hovedrollen samt hans engagement pÃ¥ settet. â€Jeg har absolut ingen interesse i at fjerne fokus fra veteransagen, for mÃ¥let med filmen er at bidrage til en samtale om veteraners vilkÃ¥r i Danmark, og det hÃ¥ber jeg virkelig, at vi lykkes med,â€ fortsÃ¦tter han. I dag har Danske FilminstruktÃ¸rer valgt at orientere sine medlemmer om sagen i en mail. â€Som instruktÃ¸r, og isÃ¦r som debuterende, stÃ¥r man ofte meget sÃ¥rbar og alene, og er i meget hÃ¸j grad afhÃ¦ngig af opbakning fra de stÃ¦rke kreative krÃ¦fter, man har med sig. IsÃ¦r fra sin hovedrolleindehaver,â€ skriver forperson SÃ¸ren Balle og tilfÃ¸jer. â€NÃ¥r et medlem fortÃ¦ller os, at han oplever grÃ¦nseoverskridende adfÃ¦rd, bliver vi nÃ¸dt til at tage det meget alvorligt.â€ Foreningen kritiserer ogsÃ¥, at en part i sagen, Dar Salim, udtaler sig til pressen. â€Til stor skade for de involverede og i sidste ende ogsÃ¥ filmen og filmens fokusomrÃ¥de. Nemlig, at vi som samfund ikke har Ã¸je for vores krigsveteraner.â€ Danske FilminstruktÃ¸rer Ã¸nsker stadig en uafhÃ¦ngig arbejdsmiljÃ¸undersÃ¸gelse af produktionen. Sker det ikke, vil man selv tage initiativ til en undersÃ¸gelse. Producentens prioritet Amalie Lyngbo Quist fra Beo Starling har som arbejdsgiver ansvaret for at sÃ¸rge for, at alle er trygge pÃ¥ produktionen. Men hun mener ikke, at hun har svigtet sin uerfarne instruktÃ¸r til fordel for stjernen Dar Salim. â€Jeg genkender ikke, at der skulle have vÃ¦ret et ubehageligt arbejdsmiljÃ¸ pÃ¥ nogen mÃ¥de. Jeg har talt med og indhentet skriftlige vidneudsagn fra holdet i forbindelse med, at sagen opstod, og ingen udtaler, at de har oplevet det ubehageligt pÃ¥ optagelserne.â€ â€“ GÃ¦lder det ogsÃ¥ klippeprocessen? â€Det har vÃ¦ret pÃ¥ en positiv mÃ¥de, at Dar har bidraget i klipningen, og han har leveret et stort kunstnerisk bidrag til den fÃ¦rdige film.â€ â€“ Har du og Beo Starling vÃ¦ret gode nok til at styre produktionen? â€Som producent er min fornemste opgave at fÃ¥ Filminstituttets investering og de private investeringer til at blive til en sÃ¥ god film som muligt. Den her film er blevet rigtigt god, det er vi utroligt mange, der er enige om. BÃ¥de det store veteranmiljÃ¸, biograferne og Filminstituttet. Generelt er opfattelsen, at filmen er virkelig vellykket.â€ â€“ Folk pÃ¥ produktionen skal vel ogsÃ¥ have det godt undervejs? â€Ja, selvfÃ¸lgelig skal de det. Det var vigtigt for bÃ¥de Christian og mig, at veteranerne fÃ¸lte sig i gode hÃ¦nder under optagelserne. Dar kom med en kÃ¦mpe erfaring, og det var en stor opgave for Christian som debuterende spillefilminstruktÃ¸r, opdagede vi, inklusive ham selv. Derfor var vi enige om at gÃ¸re Dar til medinstruktÃ¸r pÃ¥ set. Det gjorde, at veteranerne og de Ã¸vrige medvirkende fÃ¸lte sig i gode hÃ¦nder.â€ â€“ Oplevede du selv, at Christian var usikker, og at det var en stor opgave for ham? â€Ja, det gik da op for os undervejs.â€ â€“ HvornÃ¥r fandt du ud af, at Christian havde det dÃ¥rligt? â€Han skrev det til mig i oktober 2024, mens vi var i klippeprocessen. Jeg talte sammen med hans reprÃ¦sentant i Danske FilminstruktÃ¸rer, som ikke foreslog nogle tiltag overhovedet.â€ Fanget i principiel sag Til Ekko skriver Dar Salim i en mail, at Danske FilminstruktÃ¸rers mail til sine medlemmer i dag, hvor foreningen kaldet det â€dybt problematisk, at der er blevet lÃ¦kket dokumenter, og en part i sagen har valgt at udtale sig til pressenâ€, er symptomatisk. â€Jeg er ikke afsender pÃ¥ Weekendavisens artikel. Jeg bliver kontaktet og udtaler mig selvfÃ¸lgelig, for jeg er blive anklaget for noget skÃ¸rt og har ikke noget at skjule. Avisen har alle dokumenter og ikke bare et udvalg. Danske FilminstruktÃ¸rers eget medlem, producenten og reprÃ¦sentanten for de medvirkende veteraner udtaler sig alle i artiklen,â€ skriver skuespilleren. â€Alle med forstand pÃ¥ medier ved, at jeg intet har at vinde ved at blive associeret med sÃ¥dan en sag i pressen, uagtet at alle anklager er 100 procent falske.â€ â€“ Er det ikke atypisk, at en skuespiller bliver sÃ¥ aktiv en del af klipningen? â€Jo, og jeg holdt mig i starten helt ude af processen. Men det blev nÃ¸dvendigt, at jeg kom ind, og det skete efter aftale med bÃ¥de Christian og producenten. FÃ¸rst sendte jeg blot noter til det fÃ¸rste gennemklip, som jeg var blevet bedt om.â€ â€Senere blev vi enige om, at jeg skulle komme i klipperummet af flere omgange â€“ altid sammen med klipperen, Christian og ofte ogsÃ¥ producenten. Det var konstruktive, kreative samtaler i en god og kollegial tone, og det er ogsÃ¥ skriftligt bekrÃ¦ftet af bÃ¥de klipper og producent.â€ â€PÃ¥ et tidspunkt ringer klipperen selv og fortÃ¦ller, at han har aftalt med Christian, at vi bare kunne tage dialogen direkte. Det gjorde vi sÃ¥ frem til, at jeg lukkede filmen sidste nat, og vi fik en takkemail fra Christian nÃ¦ste dag.â€ â€“ Hvad kan vi lÃ¦re af den her sag? â€I filmbranchen lÃ¸ser vi altid problemerne, uanset hvad de er. Vi holder sammen. Det gjorde vi ogsÃ¥ her. Alle slog ring om Christian Holten Bonke, hjalp til og kÃ¸rte i extra hÃ¸je omdrejninger. Og vi lykkedes jo.â€ â€Balladen opstÃ¥r fÃ¸rst, efter vi har afsluttet arbejdet og ogsÃ¥ var blevet enige om kreditering. Det er egentlig ligegyldigt, for alle pÃ¥ filmholdet ved, hvem der har gjort hvad. Vi skulle bare finde en mÃ¥de at sige â€™tak for hjÃ¦lpenâ€™ pÃ¥ og stÃ¥ sammen udadtil.â€ â€Jeg forsÃ¸gte selv i en mail, som var meget direkte og Ã¦rlig. Og det virkede. Vi blev enige. Indtil Danske FilminstruktÃ¸rer blev involveret. Mindre end et dÃ¸gn senere dukker det famÃ¸se brev op, fyldt med de udokumenterede anklager og trusler mod bÃ¥de producenten og min person, hvor jeg bliver benÃ¦vnt som â€™stjerneskuespillerâ€™.â€ â€“ Men det er vel Danske FilminstruktÃ¸rers pligt at skride ind, hvis et medlem har lidt psykisk overlast? â€Ja, jeg er helt enig med forperson SÃ¸ren Balle i, at hvis nogen fÃ¸ler sig krÃ¦nket, skal det tages alvorligt. Det gÃ¸r man ved at undersÃ¸ge, hvad der er sket â€“ grundigt og professionelt. Og give den bistand, som vedkommende har brug for, hvis han eller hun har slÃ¥et sig.â€ â€Man gÃ¸r det ikke ved at sende udokumenterede anklager mod en kollega, der loyalt har hjulpet. Og slet ikke ved stÃ¦digt at fastholde dem i syv mÃ¥neder, pÃ¥ trods af samtlige andre involverede beskriver en anden virkelighed.â€ â€Jeg oplever, at vi alle er blevet fanget i en principiel sag, hvor Danske FilminstruktÃ¸rer frygter, at fremtidige debutanter kan risikere at skulle afgive rettigheder til andre faggrupper. Jeg har fuld forstÃ¥else for den bekymring og Ã¸nsker ikke at rokke en centimeter ved instruktÃ¸rernes rettigheder. Hvis sagen var blevet hÃ¥ndteret professionelt og kollegialt, havde vi fundet en lÃ¸sning.â€ Ekko har forelagt kritikken for Sandra Piras, sekretariatschef i Danske FilminstruktÃ¸rer, men foreningen Ã¸nsker ikke at sagsbehandle i offentligheden. title: DR fyrer Sandy French
author: Af Frederik Hoff
body_text: Du er her: Artikler | Nyhed | DR fyrer Sandy French RSS-feed / artikler Nyhed 01. okt. 2025 | 15:15 DR fyrer Sandy French Foto | Agnete Schlichtkrull Sandy French har siddet pÃ¥ posten som nyhedsdirektÃ¸r hos DR siden 2017, men nu skal der nye krÃ¦fter til. UndersÃ¸gelsen kom i stand, fordi Frihedsbrevet afslÃ¸rede, at nyhedsdirektÃ¸ren fra januar 2020 til januar 2025 havde kÃ¸rt taxa mindst 521 gange. Jeg har fÃ¥et lov til at arbejde sammen med de dygtigste medarbejdere og chefer og det har vÃ¦ret meningsfuldt, udfordrende og motiverende hver eneste dag,â€ udtaler hun i meddelelsen. â€At nye krÃ¦fter skal til, er et vilkÃ¥r pÃ¥ det her niveau, og jeg videregiver trygt DR Nyheder til min efterfÃ¸lger. Jeg har stor respekt for Bjarne Corydon og hans projekt med at sikre DRâ€™s position i fremtiden. title: Den perfekte kunstner
author: Af Peter Schepelern
body_text: Du er her: Artikler | Nekrolog | Den perfekte kunstner RSS-feed / artikler Nekrolog 29. sep. 2025 | 21:54 Nekrolog: Den perfekte kunstner Foto | Zentropa JÃ¸rgen Leth var indbegrebet af Ã¦stetikeren, men i De fem benspÃ¦nd (2003) udfordrer Lars von Trier ham til at nyde en overdÃ¥dig middag midt i Mumbais slum, mens sultne lokale ser til â€“ en isnende kontrast mellem stil og social virkelighed. JÃ¸rgen Leth var en filmisk globetrotter, hvis metode var at betragte verden med fremmede Ã¸jne. Hans betydning rakte langt ud over salgstal og seertal â€“ han blev et folkeligt ikon og en original stemme i dansk kultur. Af Peter Schepelern I over 50 Ã¥r og over 50 film var han den danske filminstruktÃ¸r, der mest tappert og standhaftigt modstod mainstreamfilmens lokketoner. Gennem hele sin karriere holdt han sig demonstrativt fri af enhver udsigt til nem kommerciel gevinst, ligesom ogsÃ¥ risikoen for et folkeligt gennembrud skulle synes at vÃ¦re minimal. I stedet formÃ¥ede han kompromislÃ¸st at fastholde sin personlige stemme gennem hele livsvÃ¦rket â€“ og paradoksalt nok lykkedes det ham samtidig at blive en populÃ¦r medieperson og et folkeligt ikon i dansk kultur. Annonce At vÃ¦re filminstruktÃ¸r er kun noget, man kan vÃ¦re, hvis man fÃ¥r lov til at vÃ¦re det. Man kan skrive litteratur eller male malerier for egen regning â€“ helt uden omgivelsernes pÃ¥skÃ¸nnelse. Men filminstruktÃ¸r kan man kun vÃ¦re, hvis man fÃ¥r lov. JÃ¸rgen Leth fik lov, fordi han ved siden af sit kunstneriske talent ogsÃ¥ havde det nÃ¦sten lige sÃ¥ vigtige talent at kunne begejstre dem, der skulle give ham lov. Hemmeligheden var hans personlighed. Han kunne overtale og charmere producenter og konsulenter til at lade ham fÃ¥ sin vilje. Og derfor kunne han fÃ¦rdes ad sin helt sÃ¦regne vej og lege alvorlige lege efter alle kunstens spilleregler â€“ en menneskealder fÃ¸r dogmebevÃ¦gelsen. Han digtede med filmsprogets muligheder og umuligheder i en sÃ¸gen, der formÃ¥ede pÃ¥ en gang at vÃ¦re konsekvent og impulsiv. Triers generÃ¸se mobning JÃ¸rgen Leth var en filmisk globetrotter. Som en slags besÃ¸gende fra en anden klode â€“ dog med opvÃ¦kst i Aarhus â€“ tog han verden i Ã¸jesyn med et blik af aldrig svigtende nysgerrighed. Det var hans metode at betragte verden med fremmede Ã¸jne. En fremmed verden, som han fandt i USA, Kina, Ny Guinea og ikke mindst i Haiti, med 1995-filmen Haiti. Uden titel. Men det fremmede blik rettede han ogsÃ¥ mod det velkendte. Mod hverdagen i Danmark â€“ i Livet i Danmark, hans uovertrufne vÃ¦rk inden for Danmarksfilm-genren. Han var pÃ¥ samme tid en eksklusiv avantgardist og en etnografisk opdagelsesrejsende. Han kom vidt omkring i kunsten, livet og geografien, mens han gjorde notater i sine utallige notesbÃ¸ger om kÃ¦rligheden, det gode og det onde. Hans sÃ¦rkende var en kort, prÃ¦cis prosa â€“ skarp som en observation og enkel som en sÃ¦tning, der nÃ¦gter at forklare mere end nÃ¸dvendigt. Han lavede dokumentarisk avantgarde og avantgardistisk dokumentar. Han tog ogsÃ¥ livtag med spillefilmen, uden at hans kÃ¦rlighed dog blev rigtigt gengÃ¦ldt. Han tilbragte en forÃ¥rsdag i helvede og spenderede mange sommeruger pÃ¥ cykelsportens landeveje. Han udfoldede evnen til at opdage sit eget strukturelle system i alt mellem himmel og jord: bordtennis, fodbold, boksning, men ogsÃ¥ ballet, guldalderkultur og forfatterskaber (sublimt i Jeg er levende â€“ SÃ¸ren Ulrik Thomsen, digter). Og det kulminerede i 2003 med et af filmkunstens mest originale, finurlige og vittige vÃ¦rker: De fem benspÃ¦nd, hvor han satte sin kunst og sin personlighed pÃ¥ spil i et drilagtigt medspil og modspil med Lars von Trier. Her mÃ¥tte Leth lave fem gentagelser af det tidlige kortfilmmestervÃ¦rk fra 1968, Det perfekte menneske pÃ¥ skiftende betingelser, dikteret af Trier, der udsatte Leth for generÃ¸s mobning pÃ¥ hÃ¸jeste, kreative niveau. Livsnyder med depressioner Gennem en livslang bestrÃ¦belse opbyggede han â€“ som en slags kurator â€“ et cinematografisk museum, fuldt af betydningsladede fragmenter. SmÃ¥ stumper virkelighed, smÃ¥ stykker funklende tid. Det blev indsamlet af en kunstner, der med usvÃ¦kket fascination stirrede pÃ¥ den verden, som han samtidig â€“ med hele sin suverÃ¦ne Ã¦stetik â€“ behÃ¦ndigt undgik at tage ansvaret for. Han var ogsÃ¥ en sprogkunstner med et forfatterskab pÃ¥ over 40 titler og med en stemme og en sÃ¦regen diktion, der blev folkeeje. FÃ¸rst og fremmest via hans legendariske cykellÃ¸bskommentarer og sÃ¥ at sige kanoniseret, da han indtalte stoppesteder i barndomsbyens letbane. Han var en hedonistisk livsnyder med hang til depression, en blid og generÃ¸s personlighed, men ogsÃ¥ med principper, han var klar til at forsvare. Som da han kom nÃ¦rvÃ¦rende magasin til undsÃ¦tning, da vi var under angreb. Han havde smag for et luksusmÃ¥ltid i Bombays slum, og han fik i 66 scener fra Amerika Andy Warhol til at spise en burger pÃ¥ en mÃ¥de, som kunne have gjort Andy verdensberÃ¸mt i femten minutter, hvis han ikke allerede var det. Den store skandale I 2005 blev han ramt af en af kulturlivets stÃ¸rste skandaler nogensinde. Det var udlÃ¸st af en erindringsbog, hvor han frimodigt fortÃ¦ller om seksuelle oplevelser med unge kvinder under eksotiske himmelstrÃ¸g. Han havde flere gange tidligere berettet om sit â€Gauguin-syndromâ€, men nu var det et par sÃ¦tninger, der skabte furore: â€Jeg tager kokkens datter, nÃ¥r jeg vil. Det er min ret.â€ Det var lÃ¦nge inden #MeToo slog igennem. Men en flodbÃ¸lge af forargelse rejste sig, ivrigt oppisket af Ekstra Bladet, og Leth mistede bÃ¥de sin titel som honorÃ¦r konsul i Haiti og sit faste job som Tour de France-kommentator pÃ¥ TV 2, ligesom Det Danske Filminstitut trak stÃ¸tten til den planlagte film om det erotiske menneske. Han svarede med en digtsamling: Det gÃ¸r ikke noget. Ingen kunne selvfÃ¸lgelig undre sig over, at tidsÃ¥nden mÃ¥tte se strengt pÃ¥ en Ã¦ldre, hvid og europÃ¦isk mands forhold til unge kvinder fra den tredje verden. Men det pÃ¥faldende er, at kvinderne aldrig stod frem med anklager. Det var kun den offentlige opinion, der blev krÃ¦nket. Og efter nogle Ã¥r blev hans status genetableret. Hans popularitet som kulturikon steg til nye hÃ¸jder, ikke mindst blandt ungdommen. Han begyndte at lave spoken word-musik om sine livsbetragtninger og sÃ¦rheder med Mikael Simpson og Frithjof Toksvig under navnet Vi Sidder Bare Her. Og han fik lavet Det erotiske menneske. Kalenderen var fuld til det sidste. JÃ¸rgen Leth blev fÃ¸dt i 1937 og dÃ¸de i 2025, 88 Ã¥r gammel. Han blev gift og skilt tre gange i sine yngre Ã¥r og fik fire bÃ¸rn: Karoline, Asger, Kristian og Tomas â€“ tre af dem har fÃ¥et en karriere i kunstens verden. Selv var han indbegrebet af en Ã¦stetiker i Kierkegaards forstand, det vil sige ironisk, iagttagende, dialektiker, erfaren i nydelse. Alt â€“ togrejser, sex, cykellÃ¸b, naturkatastrofer, politik, alderdom â€“ blev til kunst. Og alt handlede til syvende og sidst om ham selv. Med den famÃ¸se erindringsbog fremtrÃ¥dte han som Det uperfekte menneske. Men han var den perfekte kunstner. title: 97% of Call of Duty: Black Ops 7 Beta Cheaters Were Caught 'Within 30 Minutes of Signing In,' Activision Says
body_text: Related reads:After the Week Microsoft Had You'd Be Forgiven for Believing a Rumor That Xbox Had Canceled Its Next-Gen Hardware Plans, but the Company Insists It's False 97% of Call of Duty: Black Ops 7 cheaters were caught within 30 minutes of signing into the beta, Activision has said.The mega publisher said that its anti-cheat effort, dubbed Team Ricochet, "hit the ground running," and that "fewer than 1% of cheating attempts reached a match.""Cheaters were expected. But our upgraded systems caught them faster than ever, powered by strengthened TPM 2.0 checks and automated systems helping to eliminate a large number of attempts to cheat," Activision explained. "Those who did manage to slip through didnâ€™t last long. Most never made it into a match."You may have seen clips of cheaters in the Black Ops 7 Beta. We had already actioned on most of those accounts before they hit social media. Weâ€™re watching closely, acting in real time, and learning from every attempt."Activision also reminded players that while Team Ricochet's anti-cheat detection systems stop most cheaters even reaching a match, player reports "still play a vital role" as they "help fuel our detection models, refine enforcement and improve coverage."Interestingly, Activision also spoke about the individuals and companies that sell cheats, saying most major cheat providers have admitted their tools are "unusable" for Black Ops 7, and is targeting them "beyond in-game enforcement," having closed over 40 cheat developers and resellers since Black Ops 6 launched last year."And this is just the beginning. When launch arrives, every layer of protection will be in full force, and Ricochet Anti-Cheatâ€™s defenses will only grow stronger," the statement concluded. "The fight against cheating is an industry-wide challenge â€“ and weâ€™re committed to leading the charge. We continue to bring new systems online during Beta, fine-tuning our protections, responding faster and gaining deeper insights. Weâ€™re dedicated to transparency, community feedback, and constant evolution in our fight for fair play."Last week, Activision said it was well aware that cheaters would strike the Black Ops 7 beta, and warned PC gamers that they would not be able to play during the beta or at launch if they do not enable TPM 2.0 and Secure Boot. It also added that getting cheats in the beta is "exactly what we want because Team Ricochet is here, watching, learning, and removing them as they appear. Any account permanently banned for cheating during the Beta will be banned across all Call of Duty titles, from Call of Duty: Modern Warfare to future releases."If youâ€™re looking to jump into the beta while it's live, we've got a guide on how to get into the BO7 Early Access Beta, plus how to enable Secure Boot for BO7 if youâ€™re on PC. Weâ€™ve also got details of all the BO7 unlockable weapons, and the BO7 Twitch drops you can get your hands on.Vikki Blake is a reporter for IGN, as well as a critic, columnist, and consultant with 15+ years experience working with some of the world's biggest gaming sites and publications. She's also a Guardian, Spartan, Silent Hillian, Legend, and perpetually High Chaos. Find her at BlueSky. Related reads:Microsoft Appears to Have Quietly Ditched the 10% Xbox Game Pass DLC Discount â€” Including for COD Points â€” This Week

title: SÃ¦sonens bedste film til halv pris
author: Af Frederik Hoff
body_text: Du er her: Artikler | Nyhed | SÃ¦sonens bedste film til halv pris RSS-feed / artikler Nyhed 19. sep. 2025 | 07:59 SÃ¦sonens bedste film til halv pris Foto | Ghoulardi Film Company Karismatiske Leonardo DiCaprio spiller en tidligere aktivist i en guerillagruppe i One Battle After Another. Paul Thomas Andersons One Battle After Another, Ã¥rets Guldpalmevinder og en lovende dansk debutfilm kan ses billigt med Filmporten-medlemskab, der ogsÃ¥ kan fÃ¥s gennem et Ekko-abonnement. Af Frederik Hoff â€Sikke en vanvittig film!â€ sagde legenden Steven Spielberg ifÃ¸lge mediet The Film Stage efter en forhÃ¥ndsvisning af One Battle After Another. Filmen er instrueret af ingen ringere end Paul Thomas Anderson, der er kendt for mesterlige vÃ¦rker som There Will Be Blood, Boogie Nights, Magnolia og Licorice Pizza. â€Der er mere action i den fÃ¸rste time end i alle dine andre film tilsammen. Det hele er virkelig utroligt. Det er et sammenkog af bizarre og samtidig relevante elementer, som er blevet endnu mere relevante, siden du gik i gang med at lave filmen,â€ sagde Spielberg til Paul Thomas Anderson. Annonce Filmen er baseret pÃ¥ Thomas Pynchons roman Vineland og handler om en gruppe tidligere medlemmer af en revolutionÃ¦r gruppe. Leonardo DiCaprio har trukket sig tilbage, men mÃ¥ trÃ¦de i karakter, da en gammel fjende dukker op, og hans datter kommer i fare. I det kommende nummer af Ekko, der er pÃ¥ gaden 3. oktober, placerer vi Paul Thomas Andersons film i revolutionsdrÃ¸mmernes store krÃ¸nike. IfÃ¸lge The Film Stage har Steven Spielberg allerede set One Battle After Another tre gange. Vil man gÃ¸re ham kunsten efter, kan man gÃ¸re det billigere med Filmporten, som er en kunstnerisk pendant til den mere mainstreamorienterede Biografklub Danmark. Her fÃ¥r medlemmerne nemlig halv pris pÃ¥ tolv film, heriblandt One Battle After Another. Der kommer i filmklubben Ã©n ny film hver mÃ¥ned, sÃ¥ der er virkelig mange penge at spare. Ekko har et samarbejde med Filmporten, sÃ¥ man ved at tegne abonnement pÃ¥ magasinet ogsÃ¥ kan fÃ¥ halv pris pÃ¥ tolv Filmporten-billetter. Det er en billetbesparelse pÃ¥ mindst 540 kroner, og billetterne kan bruges over flere sÃ¦soner. NÃ¸jes man med at kÃ¸be medlemskab til Filmporten, koster det 120 kroner, som er tjent hjem efter bare to eller tre film. LÃ¦s mere pÃ¥ Filmportens hjemmeside! Guldpalmevinder og Cillian Murphy Denne sÃ¦sons Filmporten-program er sÃ¦rligt imponerende. Foruden Paul Thomas Andersons actionvÃ¦rk, som fÃ¥r premiere 25. september, byder biografklubben blandt andet pÃ¥ Ã¥rets Guldpalmevinder i Cannes: iranske Jafar Panahis It Was Just an Accident. Filmen fÃ¥r premiere 19. februar og handler om mand, der mÃ¥ske finder sin tidligere torturbÃ¸ddel fra fÃ¦ngslet og mÃ¥ overveje, om han bÃ¸r gribe chancen for hÃ¦vn. I det kommende nummer af Ekkos kalder vores anmelder Panahis vÃ¦rk for en uomgÃ¦ngelig film, der kun er blevet mere aktuel af Israels angreb pÃ¥ Iran i juni. Og filmen har en af de mest kuldegysende lydlige slutninger i filmhistorien! Allerede til november kan man med Filmporten fÃ¥ rabat pÃ¥ det lovende, danske drama Ingen kÃ¦re mor. Birthe Neuman, Lene Maria Christensen og Freja Klint Sandberg spiller tre generationer fra samme familie, der lukker sandhederne ud ved juletid i Charlotte Brodthagens debutfilm. InstruktÃ¸ren har flere film pÃ¥ Ekko Shortlist og NedtÃ¦llinger blev nomineret til en pris ved Ekko Shortlist Awards. I Filmportens program finder vi ogsÃ¥ det irske periodedrama Small Things like These, som har premiere til oktober. Cillian Murphy (Oppenheimer, Peaky Blinders) spiller en familiefar, der opdager Magdalene-nonneordens forbrydelser. 11. december er der premiere pÃ¥ det psykologiske drama A Private Life med Jodie Foster som psykiater pÃ¥ jagt efter sin patients morder. title: Ekos Vol. 2 Expands the New Universe From Marvel Studios Co-Founder David Maisel
body_text: Related reads:Ekos Vol. 2 - Official Graphic Novel Trailer Last year, Marvel Studios co-founder David Maisel and Aspen Comics teamed up to debut Ekos, a new shared universe based on the work of the late Michael Turner and former DC Chief Creative Officer Geoff Johns. Ekos Vol. 1 proved to be a hit, so it's only fitting that the series returns for Vol. 2.With the crowdfunding campaign for Ekos Vol. 2 gearing up soon, IGN can exclusively debut a new trailer for the graphic novel. Check it out in the video player above or embedded below:Ekos Vol. 2 is the second act of a planned trilogy of graphic novels. The creative team includes writer J.T. Krul, pencil artist Alex Konat, digital inker Mark Roslan, color artist Peter Steigerwald, and letterer Josh Reed. The book is produced by Maisel and Aspen Comics. Here's the official logline for the book:Ekos Volume 2 continues the story of a new superstar in Grell, who in Volume 1 embarked on a journey to discover the world of Ekos. Grell encountered many of the beloved characters from Michael Turnerâ€™s legacy, including superstars Aspen (Fathom) and Grace (Soulfire), and joined forces with them on a shared mission. Remarkably, Ekos is the first time these characters have all come together in the same universe, and now Volume 2 continues their journey as they deal with turmoil within their realms and climactic interactions with the humans!You can visit the pre-launch page for the Ekos Vol. 2 Kickstarter to learn more about the book.In other comic book news, check out our exclusive previews of Adventure Time: The Bubbline College Special #1 and Dracula: Book III - The Count.Jesse is a mild-mannered staff writer for IGN. Allow him to lend a machete to your intellectual thicket by following @jschedeen on BlueSky.

title: World of Warcraft is getting two major changes in Midnight that are already dividing the community
body_text: Related reads:World of Warcraft: Midnight â€“ The First Hands-On Preview World of Warcraft is on the brink of two of the biggest changes the game has ever seen. Two changes that already seem to divide the WoW community, with many supporters and opponents. With the release of the next expansion â€“ Midnight â€“ Blizzard will block the use of certain combat addons and make all classes in the game significantly easier to play. All classes will have fewer abilities, making rotations easier to execute. This should mean that addons are no longer needed to properly complete boss fights, and WoW is taking a much-needed direction that has been inevitable for years. The game had become too complex for newcomers, and the two main culprits are now being addressed. But, as mentioned, not everyone is happy about it. The big benefit of addons The discussion about the difficulty of the game and the impact of third-party addons has been ongoing for quite some time. Hardcore players who do nothing but play World of Warcraft have been using addons for years and know them inside and out. They can hardly imagine the game without these community-made additions â€“ and rightly so! Addons have often made World of Warcraft more accessible and clearer. For example, there is the addon Weakauras, which lets you customize your game and add alerts. These range from simple things like â€œdonâ€™t forget to summon your pet!â€ to complex systems that provide more information to deaf players than Blizzard itself offers. For instance, there is a guild made up entirely of deaf players who say that thanks to this addon, they can also complete the gameâ€™s toughest content. The tools Blizzard provides are simply insufficient, and this is one of the groups concerned about the upcoming changes. Was I a Good Addon? by u/nothix in wow Addons had become such a major part of the game that Blizzard even started designing bosses with the knowledge that players would create tools to help the entire community defeat them. The top raiding guilds, competing to be the first to kill the final boss on Mythic difficulty, even had Weakaura creators in their teams who built new alerts on the fly to give raiders more information during fights. This will all come to an end when Midnight launches. In the Midnight alpha, available for about a week now, players are getting their first look at Blizzardâ€™s built-in â€œaddons.â€ Blizzard acknowledges that players do need extra information in some cases, but they no longer want this to come from addons. Instead, several features will be integrated directly into the game. You can now create Weakaura-like displays for your cooldowns, a built-in boss alert system is replacing Deadly Boss Mods and similar addons, and a damage meter is being added. Unfortunately, at the time of writing, these features are far less comprehensive than the addons players have been relying on for years. A new way of playing is coming This could simply be because Midnight is still in its alpha phase and many features are yet to be added based on player feedback. For example, I expect Blizzard to look at accessibility options for deaf players, as accessibility is very important to them. But I especially expect gameplay as a whole to shift. When classes are simplified and addons less extensive, bosses will also need to be adjusted. Hardcore players still want to be challenged to the max, and Blizzard intends to deliver that. Rotations will be easier and there will be fewer addon warnings, so the structure of boss fights must change. I think Blizzard will focus more on dodging attacks and completing tasks during fights, rather than emphasizing perfect rotations and passing healing or damage checks. Of course, these elements already exist in the game, but I believe they will become even more central. In my opinion, these are all welcome changes, since they address problems Iâ€™ve personally run into, and I believe the game needs them. Even though hardcore players wonâ€™t like it, and there are still many improvements to be made to the new features at this stage. I used to be a hardcore player myself. I raided four nights a week on Mythic, played multiple characters, and practically all my gaming time went into WoW. But now that Iâ€™m older and have more responsibilities, I often play the game with months-long breaks. What always gets in my way is that when I return, I first spend two hours updating addons, reading on WoWHead about the best single- and multi-target rotations, and checking in-game â€œwhere was I again?â€ By the time I finish all that, Iâ€™ve already lost the motivation to play. I know WoW friends of mine face the same issue, and I think integrating addons into the base game and simplifying classes will help with this problem â€“ especially when playing multiple characters. It becomes much more appealing to play several characters if you donâ€™t need to be a rocket scientist to play them all effectively. Recommending World of Warcraft to your friends will become much easier It will also be much easier to recommend the game. I always talk enthusiastically about World of Warcraft to my friends who donâ€™t play it, and sometimes I convince them to try. But often, they quit after just a few hours. Their character suddenly became very complicated to play, veteran players expected them to have all the addons installed to share information, and the story was nearly impossible to understand. That last part is something Blizzard still needs to figure out, since solving narrative issues in a 20-year-old game is even harder. But at least with Midnight, I feel more confident recommending the game to my friends, since they wonâ€™t need addons and classes are much easier to grasp. I cannot stress enough how important this is for the game. Itâ€™s amazing that WoW has attracted so many hardcore players for 20 years, but that group is shrinking over time. Players have kids or other responsibilities, move on to different games, or become casual WoW players like me. The game needs a steady influx of new players, or it will slowly fade away. Iâ€™m very curious if World of Warcraft can attract a new generation â€“ currently only interested in Fortnite and Roblox. I would find it a shame if WoW dies a slow death, because I still dream of playing it with my WoW buddies when I retire, with endless free time. Most likely from our couches, since these changes also hint that World of Warcraft is preparing for a console release, where fewer buttons and no need for addons become even more important. But that may be a discussion for later. For now, itâ€™s time for Midnight, and in the coming months weâ€™ll find out how these changes will affect one of the most iconic games of all time. Related reads:World of Warcraft: Midnight Cinematic Images and First Screenshots

title: A Knight of the Seven Kingdoms Showrunner Explains the Big Difference With Game of Thrones That Fans Will Instantly Notice
body_text: Related reads:HBO Max Chief Reveals 2026 Release Months for Game of Thrones Spinoff a Knight of the Seven Kingdoms and House of the Dragon Series 3 The showrunner of A Knight of the Seven Kingdoms has explained one of the big differences with the other two Game of Thrones series.A Knight of the Seven Kingdoms, due out on HBO Max in January 2026, adapts George R. R. Martinâ€™s Tales of Dunk and Egg novella trilogy, itself a prequel to Game of Thrones set 90 years before the events of the main books.It's a significant release for HBO Max, but it differs from Game of Thrones and prior spinoff House of the Dragon in a number of key ways, one of which will be sure to spark an instant reaction from fans.Warning! Spoilers for A Knight of the Seven Kingdoms follows:As detailed by Entertainment Weekly, A Knight of the Seven Kingdoms does not have an opening title sequence. This is particularly surprising given Game of Thronesâ€™ iconic opening sequence, which is embedded in the memory of an army of fans.Instead, as EW described it, A Knight of the Seven Kingdoms has â€œa simple title card with medieval typography in between the beginning action of each episode.â€Showrunner Ira Parker said the decision was made due to the type of show A Knight of the Seven Kingdoms is and who its characters, Ser Duncan the Tall and Egg, are.â€œAll decisions came down to Dunk, trying to channel the type of person he is into every aspect of this show, even the title sequence," Parker explained.â€œThe title sequences on the original [Game of Thrones] and House of the Dragon are big and epic and incredible. Ramin Djawadiâ€™s score is orchestral and large and beautiful. That's not really Dunkâ€™s M.O. Heâ€™s plain and heâ€™s simple and heâ€™s to-the-point. He doesn't have a lot of flash to him.â€Donâ€™t expect dragons and a big, magical scale to this show, either. â€œNobody's thinking about magic,â€ Parker said. â€œThis could basically be 14th century Britain. This is hard nose, grind it out, gritty, medieval knights, cold with a really light, hopeful touch. It's a wonderful place to be. We are ground up in this series, we are starting right at the bottom. We're not with the lords and ladies, the kings and queens."In March this year, House of the Dragon showrunner Ryan Condal called Game of Thrones author George R.R. Martinâ€™s criticisms of the seriesâ€™ second season â€œdisappointing.â€Drama in the Game of Thrones world began when Martin promised to dive into â€œeverything thatâ€™s gone wrong with House of the Dragonâ€ in August last year. Itâ€™s a promise he kept, going on to call out plot elements related to Aegon and Helaenaâ€™s children as he expressed concern for how future seasons of the show might play out. The post was eventually removed from the authorâ€™s website without explanation but not before thousands of fans â€” and HBO â€” caught wind of the grievances it presented.But Martin sounds a lot more enthusiastic about A Knight of the Seven Kingdoms than House of the Dragon â€” Martin teased earlier this year that he couldnâ€™t wait to see Dunk and Eggâ€™s story come to TV screens.â€œIâ€™ve seen all six episodes now (the last two in rough cuts, admittedly), and I loved them," Martin said in a blog post in January. "Dunk and Egg have always been favorites of mine, and the actors we found to portray them are just incredible. The rest of the cast are terrific as well. Wait until you guys meet the Laughing Storm and Tanselle Too-Tall.â€Martin continued to celebrate A Knight of the Seven Kingdoms, adding: â€œItâ€™s as faithful an adaptation as a reasonable man could hope for (and you all know how incredibly reasonable I am on that particular subject).â€Despite Martinâ€™s towering praise, weâ€™ve seen little from the show since it was announced in 2021. After locking in actors Peter Claffey and Dexter Sol Ansell to play Ser Duncan the Tall and Egg, respectively, HBO went on to reveal one image from the show in June 2024. A brief teaser trailer followed in August, showing a glimpse at some of the seriesâ€™ major players and a few shots of familiar Game of Thrones action.House of the Dragon Season 3, meanwhile, is set for release early summer 2026. In a separate interview with Deadline, June was suggested.Wesley is Director, News at IGN. Find him on Twitter at @wyp100. You can reach Wesley at wesley_yinpoole@ign.com or confidentially at wyp100@proton.me. Related reads:George R.R. Martin Calls Game of Thrones Show a Knight of the Seven Kingdoms 'As Faithful an Adaptation as a Reasonable Man Could Hope For'

body_text: UdlandI dag kl. 15.45Opdateret i dag kl. 15.45Israel: Dansk aktivist fra Gaza-flotille er blandt deporteredeEn talsperson fra organisationen Free Gaza Movement bekrÃ¦fter, at en dansker har vÃ¦ret tilbageholdt i Israel.Lyt KÃ¸171 aktivister fra en nÃ¸dhjÃ¦lpsflotille med kurs mod Gaza, som Israel stoppede i sidste uge, er blevet deporteret - herunder mindst Ã©n dansker.Det oplyser Israels udenrigsministerium i et opslag pÃ¥ X.Gruppen er blevet deporteret til henholdsvis GrÃ¦kenland og Slovakiet.Talsperson fra organisationen Free Gaza Movement Bent Erik KrÃ¸yer bekrÃ¦fter over for Ritzau, at en dansk kvinde har vÃ¦ret tilbageholdt i Israel efter at have vÃ¦ret om bord pÃ¥ et skib i flotillen.Han fortÃ¦ller, at forventningen har vÃ¦ret, at hun skulle deporteres.- Det glÃ¦der mig meget, at det formentlig er hende, der er pÃ¥ vej hjem. For det har vÃ¦ret hÃ¥rdt at vÃ¦re fÃ¦ngslet dernede, siger han.Aktivisterne, som er blevet deporteret, kommer fra en lang rÃ¦kke lande.Der er foruden Danmark tale om GrÃ¦kenland, Italien, Frankrig, Irland, Sverige, Polen, Tyskland, Bulgarien, Litauen, Ã˜strig, Luxemburg, Finland, Slovakiet, Schweiz, Norge, Storbritannien, Serbien og USA.Blandt dem er den svenske aktivist Greta Thunberg, der kan ses pÃ¥ flere billeder, som Israels udenrigsministerium har offentliggjort pÃ¥ X.- VedhÃ¦ftet er billeder af Greta og andre deltagere i dette PR-stunt i lufthavnen, fÃ¸r de blev deporteret, skriver ministeriet.Flotillen blev arrangeret af initiativet Global Sumud Flotilla.Global Sumud Flotilla oplyste natten til torsdag i sidste uge, at Israels militÃ¦r havde stoppet 13 af flotillen skibe, mens 30 skibe sejlede videre mod Gaza.De resterende skibe blev stoppet af flÃ¥den i de efterfÃ¸lgende dage, og aktivisterne om bord blev transporteret til Israel.En anden flotille, som den danske folketingspolitiker Victoria Velasquez (EL) er en del af, er stadig pÃ¥ vej til Gaza med nÃ¸dhjÃ¦lp.Denne flotille befinder sig mandag i Middelhavet nord for den egyptiske by Alexandria.IfÃ¸lge Bent Erik KrÃ¸yer fra Free Gaza Movement sejler en rÃ¦kke danskere med denne flotille./ritzau/

title: GenÃ¥bnet Tyra-felt sender gassen videre til resten af Europa | B.T.
body_text: ErhvervI dag kl. 15.39Opdateret i dag kl. 15.39GenÃ¥bnet Tyra-felt sender gassen videre til resten af EuropaDet renoverede Tyra-felt indvies mandag og kan producere dobbelt sÃ¥ meget gas, som der er brug for i Danmark.Lyt KÃ¸Det kan virke en smule paradoksalt, at genÃ¥bningen af Tyra-feltet i NordsÃ¸en markeres med en hÃ¸jtidelighed i Esbjerg mandag.I hvert fald nÃ¥r det nu engang er besluttet at gÃ¸re Danmark helt fri af kul, olie og gas fra 2050.Men der vil fortsat vÃ¦re brug for gassen fra NordsÃ¸en en rum tid endnu. Om ikke her, sÃ¥ andre steder, forklarer Martin NÃ¦sby, der er direktÃ¸r for brancheforeningen Dansk Offshore.- Europa har et kÃ¦mpebehov for gas, ikke bare i de nÃ¦ste fem-ti Ã¥r, og det kan vi bidrage til at dÃ¦kke, sÃ¥ der skal importeres mindre flydende gas fra eksempelvis USA og Qatar - eller naturgas fra Rusland.- Og sÃ¥ er det mere klimavenligt at pumpe gassen ind fra NordsÃ¸en end at transportere den i flydende form med tankskibe langvejs fra, siger direktÃ¸ren.Tyra-feltet blev oprindeligt indviet i 1984, men med tiden har havbunden sÃ¦nket sig, og derfor blev det i 2017 Ã¥r af sikkerhedshensyn besluttet at renovere installationerne.Covid 19-pandemien og efterfÃ¸lgende logistiske problemer betÃ¸d, at det nye Tyra-felt fÃ¸rst blev taget i drift i marts 2024.Det er nu oppe pÃ¥ omkring 90 procent af den forventede maksimalproduktion pÃ¥ 2,8 milliarder kubikmeter.Det svarer godt og vel til det dobbelte af Danmarks nuvÃ¦rende gasforbrug.SpÃ¸rger man Brian Vad Mathiesen, der er professor i energiplanlÃ¦gning ved Aalborg Universitet, var udfaldet af diskussionen om at renovere Tyra-feltet nok blevet en anden, hvis den var foregÃ¥et i dag.- Dengang var den offentlige debat et andet sted, og i dag vil man nok mene, at det er langt vigtigere at investere i at reducere vores gasforbrug yderligere end at bruge arbejdskraft og penge pÃ¥ at lave nye felter.- Men man mÃ¥ omvendt ogsÃ¥ sige, at nÃ¥r vi nu har noget, der reducerer vores afhÃ¦ngighed af flydende naturgas og bidrager til den europÃ¦iske forsyningssikkerhed, sÃ¥ er det fint at fÃ¥ noget ekstra ud af det, vi har i forvejen, og sÃ¥ ellers kigge fremad, siger han.Gassen fra Tyra-feltet kan enten sendes ind til det danske fastland via en gasledning til Esbjerg, eller det kan sendes sydpÃ¥ via den sÃ¥kaldte Nogat-rÃ¸rledning, der gÃ¥r i land ved hollandske Den Helder.Formelt er det Dansk Undergrunds Consortium (DUC), der har rettighederne til at udvide olie og gas i NordsÃ¸en.DUC ejes af den danske stat, Bluenord og energiselskabet Total Energies, hvis datterselskab Total E&P Danmark stÃ¥r for den praktiske opgave med at pumpe olie og gas op af undergrunden.Total E&P Danmark hed indtil 2017 MÃ¦rsk Oil og var ejet af A.P. MÃ¸ller-MÃ¦rsk-koncernen./ritzau/

title: Politiet melder ud: Advarer om maskeret mandÂ  | B.T.
