title: Megalopolis: An Original Graphic Novel Adapts 2024's Most Divisive Film
body_text: It's fair to say that Francis Ford Coppola's Megalopis was one of the most divisive pieces of pop culture released in 2024. IGN's Megalopolis review was pretty positive on Coppola's ambitious epic, but many reviews were far less kind. But, love it or hate it, Coppola fans now have the opportunity to experience this story in a whole new medium thanks to Francis Ford Coppola's Megalopolis: An Original Graphic Novel. With Megalopolis: An Original Graphic Novel in stores now, IGN can exclusively debut a new preview of the book. Check it out in the slideshow gallery below:Megalopolis is adapted from Coppola's screenplay and is written by Chris Ryall (Zombies vs. Robots) and illustrated by Jacob Phillips (That Texas Blood). The book is published by Abrams ComicArts. Here's the official description of the graphic novel:Set in the futuristic city of New Rome, Megalopolis originally captivated audiences with its masterful filmmaking, becoming one of Francis Ford Coppola's most widely discussed films. Now, in graphic novel form, it explores the gripping narrative of idealism versus corruption. Architect and dreamer Cesar Catilina seeks a utopian future, while Mayor Franklyn Cicero fights to preserve the status quoâ€”rife with greed and political warfare. Caught between these powerful forces is Julia Cicero, the mayorâ€™s daughter, whose romance with Cesar tests her loyalty and compels her to redefine her beliefs about what humanity truly deserves. The film, which features an all-star cast including Adam Driver, Giancarlo Esposito, Nathalie Emmanuel, Jon Voight, Laurence Fishburne, and Aubrey Plaza, made its world premiere last year to a 10-minute standing ovation at the prestigious Cannes Film Festival and was released theatrically and in IMAX globally on September 27, 2024."The 'Cloud Tower' sequence atop the Chrysler Building had been one of the key set pieces since the earliest days of Coppolaâ€™s development of Megalopolis. Going back decades," Ryall tells IGN about the above preview. "And itâ€™s a very effective scene in the film, with Cesar precariously perched on the edge of the building as the wind whips clouds all around. And then, weâ€™re not quite sure how he does it but Catalina commands time to STOP. And it does. The clouds freeze in the sky; the cars and pedestrians far below likewise stop."Ryall continues, "Which is all well and goodâ€¦ but how do you show that in static panels on a flat comic book page? Without the ability to freeze on a frame or use sound or moving images in a unique way to convey this, we had to find another way to stop time â€“ luckily, thatâ€™s basically what an artist does, is stop time. In this case, we played with color, flattening the colors on the page to their basics, the world in all its rich, colorful fullness stopping all around Cesar. But even amidst the flatness of the scene, itâ€™s the dialogue that gives it color. Cesar first utters the line that he repeats in multiple sequences, the phrase that basically dictates his approach to the world: 'I will not let time have dominion over my soul.'â€Francis Ford Coppola's Megalopolis: An Original Graphic Novel is available in bookstores and comic shops now. You can order a copy on Amazon.In other comic book news, check out our exclusive previews of Adventure Time: The Bubbline College Special #1 and Dracula: Book III - The Count.Jesse is a mild-mannered staff writer for IGN. Allow him to lend a machete to your intellectual thicket by following @jschedeen on BlueSky.

title: The Latest Apple iPads Are as Much as 50% Off at the Amazon Resale Store for October Prime Day
body_text: Related reads:Every iPad Generation: A Full History of Release Dates Just for October Prime Day, Amazon has activated a 35% off coupon that works on thousands of items in its Resale store - Amazon's official outlet for used products. This includes some ridiculously good discounts on late 2024 and 2025 model Apple iPads. I've purposely selected iPad models that are available in "Like New" condition. There's a good chance these items haven't been used at all and are returns from customers who have changed their minds or simply products with blemished packaging. Resale items also get the same 30-day return policy as any other Amazon purchase.Note that the 35% off coupon is reserved for Amazon Prime members only. If you don't want to commit to an annual subscription, you can just sign up for a single month for $15.Used: Like New Apple iPads at the Amazon Resale Store2025 Apple iPad 11-inchHere's a great opportunity to score a used: like new iPad for under $200. For most people, the iPad (not the Air, Mini, or Pro) is the best model to get because it offers all the benefits of iOS as well as snappy performance at an affordable price. The current generation model was released on March 12, 2025, over two years after the previous generation (October 2022). The upgrades include a more powerful processor, more RAM, and more storage.2025 iPad Air 11-inch and 13-inchThis is the only time I've seen the (latest) 7th generation Apple iPad Air M3 tablet sell for under $300. You can pick up a used: like new 11" model for just $289 or the larger 13" model for $397. In all three cases you're saving about 50% off the retail price. The 7th gen iPad Air was released in March of 2025 and is equipped with a more powerful M3 chip. The inclusion of the M3 chip also means that the new iPad Air now supports Apple Intelligence. The iPad Air also boasts an 11" 2360x1640 (264ppi) Liquid Retina display with P3 Wide Color and True Tone that's better than the standard iPad's display.Late 2024 Apple iPad Mini 8.9-InchThe current generation Apple iPad Mini (A17 Pro) normally costs $499, but rigjt now it's less than half that price for a used: like new model at the Amazon Resale Store. The new iPad Mini was released in October of 2024 and, despite its smaller footprint, features superior hardware compared to the standard Apple iPad. For starters, it's equipped with an A17 Pro processor, which is better than the A16 Bionic found in the iPad. The iPad Mini also features a sharper 8.3" 2266x1488 display (326ppi) with P3 Wide Color and True Tone. Finally, unlike the iPad, the iPad Mini is Apple Intelligence compatible.Check out more Amazon Resale dealsThe 35% off coupon works on thousands of items at the Amazon Resale store, including popular brand names and the latest products like current generation Apple iPads, Sonos soundbars and speakers, PlayStation 5 consoles, the new Sony WH-1000XM6 headphones, PS5 video games, 4K Blu-ray movies, and much more. I've compiled a list of the most popular items that are heavily discounted for October Prime Day, including deals on more Apple devices.Eric Song is the IGN commerce manager in charge of finding the best gaming and tech deals every day. When Eric isn't hunting for deals for other people at work, he's hunting for deals for himself during his free time. Related reads:The Newest Apple iPad Drops Back to Its Lowest Price Ever Ahead of Memorial Day

title: 'We're Drowning in Mediocrity': Alien Director Ridley Scott Says Modern Movies Are So Bad He's Gone Back to Watching His Own
body_text: Related reads:Alien: Earth Provides Sympathy for the Villain by Turning Him Into Ripley Ridley Scott, the director of Alien, Gladiator and Blade Runner, has slammed the current state of the movie industry â€” and said the majority of new films are "s***."The sheer number of bad movies has become such a problem, Scott told Yahoo News, that he has now begun to simply rewatch his own â€” including Black Hawk Down, which he recalled seeing again recently and being impressed by."Right now I'm finding mediocrity," the 87-year-old said of the movie industry's output. "We're drowning in mediocrity.""The quantity of movies that are made today, literally globally, [there are] millions," Scott continued. "There's not thousands, there's millions, and most of it is shit â€” 80-60% 'eh,' 40% is the rest, and 25% of that 40 is not bad, and 10% is pretty good, and the top 5% is great."Scott went on to suggest that the same ratio of good and bad films existed back in the 1940s â€” though back then, far fewer movies were being made. Today, with so many films releasing each year, the sheer bulk of mediocrity had ballooned."I think a lot of films today are saved, and made more expensive by digital effects," he added. "Because what they havenâ€™t got is a great [script] on paper first. Get it on paper."While Scott still perseveres with some new movies and TV shows â€” and uses them to scout for younger talent, he said, which is how he found Gladiator 2 star Paul Mescal after watching the actor in BBC series Normal People â€” he was also turning back to some of his own, older work to enjoy.â€œWhat I do â€” and itâ€™s a horrible thing â€” but Iâ€™ve started to watch my own movies, and actually theyâ€™re really good,â€ Scott admitted. â€œAnd also, they donâ€™t age â€¦ I watched Black Hawk Down the other night and I thought, â€˜How the hell did I do that?â€™ But I think that occasionally thereâ€™s a good one that will happen, itâ€™s like a relief that thereâ€™s somebody out there whoâ€™s doing a good movie.â€Can Scott's own future work help tip the balance? For now, the director has no plans to retire. Scott recently wrapped filming on The Dog Stars, an upcoming post-apocalyptic sci-fi film starring Euphoria's Jacob Elordi. The director has also discussed plans to make a third Gladiator film, as well as a Bee Gees biopic.Photo by Sunset Boulevard/Corbis via Getty Images.Tom Phillips is IGN's News Editor. You can reach Tom at tom_phillips@ign.com or find him on Bluesky @tomphillipseg.bsky.social Related reads:Alien: Earth - The Biggest (Acid) Burning Questions After Episodes 1 and 2

title: Cult of Blood, a Retro-Inspired Survival Horror Game, Officially Announced for PC, Xbox, and PS5
body_text: Related reads:Elon Musk Promises His xAI Studio Will Release a 'Great' AI-Generated Video Game and Grok Will Make a Movie That Is 'At Least Watchable' Both Before the End of 2026 Developer Dusty Box has officially announced its old-school-inspired single-player survival-horror game, Cult of Blood. In it, you play a police officer investigating vampires who ends up discovering a secret village of worshippers in a blood cult. Dusty Box says it's inspired by a true story. It's due out next year for PC, PS5, and Xbox Series X|S.Classic Resident Evil fans might appreciate Cult of Blood's "fixed camera angles, dramatic cutscenes, and refined tank-style controls," while combat is "chaotic and unforgiving" while "ammunition is limited but not absent, forcing you to weigh every shot carefully." Check out the announcement trailer above and the first screenshots in the gallery below.You'll find new gear and be able to upgrade it using blood souls as you fight off a possible fate as the final piece of a cult priestess's ritual to ascend as a goddess. You can try out Cult of Blood for yourself by playing the demo (and/or wishlisting the game while you're there) on Steam.Ryan McCaffrey is IGN's executive editor of previews and host of both IGN's weekly Xbox show, Podcast Unlocked, as well as our monthly(-ish) interview show, IGN Unfiltered. He's a North Jersey guy, so it's "Taylor ham," not "pork roll." Debate it with him on Twitter at @DMC_Ryan. Related reads:Burger King Says It Ditched 'Creepy King' Because He Was Scaring Off Families With Kids â€” Who Walked Straight Into McDonald's Instead

title: Nintendo Lawsuit Demands $4.5 Million Settlement From Reddit Mod Who Sold Switch ROMs, Insists Figure Is 'Nowhere Near' an Amount That Would Compensate 'For the Seriousness of the Defendant's Conduct'
body_text: Related reads:Switch Modder Who Ignored Warnings from Nintendo and Attempted to Defend Himself Without a Lawyer Ultimately Must Pay $2 Million for Enabling Piracy Nintendo is suing a Reddit moderator and alleged Switch pirate for $4.5 million, claiming the figure is "nowhere near an amount that would compensate Nintendo of America for the seriousness of the Defendant's conduct."The conduct Nintendo references is the alleged "DMCA anti-trafficking violations" of James "Archbox" Williams, a moderator on the Switch Pirates subreddit who is accused of copying and distributing pirated Nintendo Switch games. As IGN reported at the time, Nintendo tracked down the alleged Switch pirate using a combination of Reddit posts and repair orders and sued Williams for allegedly violating its digital copyrights by selling pirated copies of Switch games. It was able to locate him via an online investigation that traced Archbox to an address in Arizona.Now, in new court papers spotted by Polygon, Nintendo has filed a 30-page complaint accusing Williams of being "directly involved in creating, operating, promoting, supporting, and/or maintaining several other Pirate Shops," as well as the "Circumvention Software to facilitate widespread use of the Pirate Shops."Nintendo said it reached out to Williams in March 2024 with a cease and desist, and claimed the defendant "acknowledged his conduct violated NOA's rights and stated he would work with NOA to satisfy demands." But the megacorp alleged that Williams "did not, however, agree to cease his conduct," denied involvement with the "pirate shops," and when NOA requested he confirm in writing that he would comply with NOAâ€™s demands, "he became combative and uncooperative."Shortly thereafter, a number of the pirate shops became inaccessible as the defendant "deleted or hid evidence relevant to NOA's claims," Nintendo said, including many of his social media posts and his GitHub account. After the company tried again in May 2024 to give Williams "a final opportunity to comply," it then filed a complaint against the individual in June, claiming direct and indirect copyright violations. When the court gave permission for Nintendo to approach Williams' internet service providers in November 2024, the firm claimed the discovery "corroborated Williams' involvement.""NOA has been, and continues to be, damaged as a direct and proximate result of Williamsâ€™ conduct," the filing explained. "NOA has reason to believe that Williams has engaged in the infringing and unlawful reproduction and distribution of hundreds or thousands of copyrighted Nintendo Switch Games, and that through the various Pirate Shops, he has distributed or facilitated the distribution of thousands, if not hundreds of thousands, of unauthorized copies of such Nintendo Switch Games. NOA also has expended and continues to expend significant resources to halt or stem video game piracy, including through developing, implementing, and updating its TPMs and policing and investigating reports of piracy such as Williamsâ€™."Furthermore, there can be no question that Williamsâ€™ conduct was willful, and that his willfulness is sufficiently alleged by the Complaint. In any event, Williamsâ€™s own statements and actions are well-documented, and fully support that Williams actually knew his conduct was infringing or else acted with 'reckless disregard for, or willful blindness to, the copyright holder's rights.'"The company said that because of the "difficultly in assessing the precise amount of actual damages suffered by NOA, exacerbated by Williamsâ€™s deliberate default and refusal to participate in discovery," it is now seeking judgment in favor of Nintendo for a monetary award of $4.5 million and an injunction, but says it is not seeking "statutory damages windfall or punitive award," but "only" $150,000 for each title it believes Williams infringed the copyrights of, of which there are 30. It is also not pursuing recompense for its legal costs.Photo by BEHROUZ MEHRI/AFP via Getty Images.Vikki Blake is a reporter for IGN, as well as a critic, columnist, and consultant with 15+ years experience working with some of the world's biggest gaming sites and publications. She's also a Guardian, Spartan, Silent Hillian, Legend, and perpetually High Chaos. Find her at BlueSky. Related reads:Nintendo Indie World Showcase August 2025: Everything Announced

title: 'That Sort of Film Would Bore the Arse Off Me' â€” Ray Winstone Insists He Doesn't Regret Turning Up Drunk to His Audition With George Lucas for PadmÃ©'s Father in Star Wars: Attack of the Clones
body_text: Ray Winstone has revealed how he botched an audition for a Star Wars movie because he turned up drunk. But, as youâ€™d expect from the Londoner best known for his "hard man" roles, he has no regrets.It turns out Winstone had an audition in front of George Lucas himself for the role of Ruwee Naberrie, PadmÃ©â€™s father in Star Wars prequel movie Attack of the Clones. But he was out drinking the night before and attended the meeting drunk, which led to an awkward standoff.â€œIt didnâ€™t go well,â€ Winstone told Far Out magazine. â€œHad words and that was that. Iâ€™ve worked for George since, and he was fine. He didnâ€™t remember. Or if he did, he didnâ€™t take it to heart.â€Winstone then suggested he was left unimpressed after Lucas failed to tell him he didnâ€™t get the job himself, sending a messenger to deliver the bad - but not unexpected - news instead.â€œIâ€™d been out all night, and I turned up, and I knew I was wrong for the part as soon as I walked in, but instead of saying that, he relayed the message to me through someone else, and I took umbrage at that,â€ Winstone said.He added that he thought Lucas had jet lag because he yawned during the audition. And then, following a period of silence, Winstone remembered he was asked a question, which sounds more like it was a directive: â€œWhy donâ€™t we both have a 15-minute sleep and then Iâ€™ll f**k off?â€Ruwee Naberrie ended up being played by Australian actor Graeme Blundell, and Attack of the Clones made hundreds of millions at the global box office. But Winstone has no regrets, adding: â€œthat sort of film would bore the arse off me, all that bluescreen work.â€Still, itâ€™s fun to imagine the tough-talking Londonder playing Natalie Portmanâ€™s dad in Star Wars. Bloody hell!This isnâ€™t the first time the outspoken Winstone has recalled having a difficult time with big-budget Hollywood movie franchises. In August, Winstone spoke of his frustration with Marvel's demands for Black Widow reshoots, despite the film's director apparently being happy with his performance.Wesley is Director, News at IGN. Find him on Twitter at @wyp100. You can reach Wesley at wesley_yinpoole@ign.com or confidentially at wyp100@proton.me.

title: Feature: Valorant Champions 2025 Proves Just How Big Esports Has Become
body_text: Related reads:Interview: Valorant Executive Producer Andy Ho on the Future, Valorant on Mobile, and Valorant Champions 2025 "Gaming was once small, but now it's everywhere." With those words, the Valorant Champions Grand Finals is opened. Anyone present in Paris can confirm this. Metro stations have been completely transformed with Valorant art, and even surrounding buildings are entirely wrapped in the tournament's artwork. The fact that the final itself delivers fireworks is truly the icing on the cake. In five years, Valorant has grown into one of the biggest esports in the world. A completely sold-out Accor Arena in Paris, the final stop of the Valorant Champions 2025 tournament, proves this. World artists like Katy Perry, Lady Gaga, and Gojira will perform here later this year, but this weekend, it has been completely taken over by fanatic Valorant fans. They are watching Fnatic against NRG in the final, with the former clearly being the crowd favorite. Perhaps you've been to a match of your favorite sports team, or watched the opening of the Olympic Games or the FIFA World Cup on TV. Riot Games is no stranger to organizing major competitions, and you can feel that in the arena. Even if you don't care much for Valorant, you can't escape the goosebumps the opening ceremony causes. The atmosphere inside the venue where two titans fight for the world title remains something unique. There is also a huge difference between top Valorant players and, for example, League of Legends players. Where the GOAT Faker always plays like a robot, the games in Valorant look very different. Players challenge each other, perform real-life emotes even during the walk-out, and seize every opportunity to get under their opponent's skin. The great appeal of these tournaments is fantastically clear during the third map. Fnatic is down 2-0 in matches and is looking at an 11-1 deficit. NRG is playing almost flawlessly, and while there was room for dances and trash talk towards the opponent at the start, the frustration and defeat are etched on the faces of the Fnatic players during the first timeout on the third map. Conversely, the NRG players are clearly gaining more and more confidence and pulling off one impressive play after another. It looks like a player like me is taking on a Radiant player, and that's almost too painful to watch. The miracle that unfolds next is something out of a fairy tale, albeit with a sour ending for Fnatic. Maybe it's the pressure on NRG or the light that Fnatic saw. Because the latter manages to fight back incredibly to 12-12, and eventually, the European team secures a 13-15 win to bring the score to 2-1. For a moment, Fnatic seems on its way to an insane comeback, even managing to tie it up at 2-2. Unfortunately, the final map or the pressure doesn't favor Fnatic, and NRG deservedly wins the Valorant Champions 2025. It is a true treat for everyone present. The biggest comeback on the biggest Valorant stage ever and the emotion that is unleashed by NRG after they finally manage to clinch the win. Tears of joy in the eyes of NRG mada and tears of sadness from Boaster, the player who regularly put the opponent to shame with a dance or big mouth both before and during the matches. Despite the clear preference of the audience for Fnatic, NRG is also cheered on until the very end. In fact, when NRG scores a flawless round, they are applauded. There is an unstated brotherhood among the fans, which always creates an amicable yet tense atmosphere in the building. Because that tension lingers until the last moment. Fans continue to cheer on Fnatic until the very end, even when the neutral viewer already realizes it's a lost cause for them. It culminates in a big celebration for the winners and a somewhat sad departure for the team that just couldn't quite make it. Valorant Champions 2025 ultimately shows that Riot knows how to stage a major tournament like no other. League of Legends, Valorant, and perhaps Riftbound in the future are all highlights of the esports year. If you have the opportunity to attend one of the upcoming major tournaments, you should definitely do it.

title: Call of Duty: Black Ops 7 Beta Extended by 24 Hours, Ends Just a Day Before the Battlefield 6 Release Date
body_text: Related reads:Battlefield 6 Leaks Seem Unstoppable as Players Report Receiving Copies Days Before Launch Good news, Call of Duty: Black Ops 7 fans â€” Activision has extended its open beta to run an additional 24 hours to October 9, taking it right up to competitor Battlefield 6's release, which is slated for October 10."The reaction to the Black Ops 7 Beta so far has been awesome to see! Whether youâ€™re calling in Nukes in Multiplayer or going for high rounds in Zombies Survival, thereâ€™s plenty to jump into and we've had a ton of fun playing alongside everyone," Activision wrote in its latest blog."On behalf of all of us at Treyarch, weâ€™re truly grateful for your feedback so far... and speaking of which, we heard you might want a little more, so weâ€™re extending the Black Ops 7 Beta to 9am PT on Thursday, October 9!"The beta now includes sixth Beta MP map, Toshin, and Open playlists, which have classic matchmaking where skill is minimally considered, Activision said.Activision also confirmed it will be extending 2XP + 2X Weapon XP through the rest of the Beta "to help everyone hit level 30, try out all the weapons and gear, and unlock plenty of attachments and Overclocks along the way."If youâ€™re looking to jump into the beta while it's live, we've got a guide on how to get into the BO7 Early Access Beta, plus how to enable Secure Boot for BO7 if youâ€™re on PC. Weâ€™ve also got details of all the BO7 unlockable weapons, and the BO7 Twitch drops you can get your hands on.Call of Duty: Black Ops 7 extended beta features:MAPSâ€¢ MP: Toshin (NEW), Blackheart, Cortex, Exposure, Imprint, The Forgeâ€¢ Zombies: Vandorn Farm (extended to end of Beta)PLAYLISTSâ€¢ MP: Open Moshpit, Moshpit, Open Hardcore Moshpit, Search & Destroy (NEW), Training Courseâ€¢ Zombies: Survival, Training CourseMODESâ€¢ Team Deathmatch (Core + Hardcore)â€¢ Domination (Core + Hardcore)â€¢ Hardpointâ€¢ Kill Confirmedâ€¢ Overloadâ€¢ Search & DestroyBlack Ops 7 has set its official release date for November 14. This week, Activision revealed that 97% of Call of Duty: Black Ops 7 cheaters were caught within 30 minutes of signing into the beta, and "fewer than 1% of cheating attempts reached a match." PC gamers cannot play unless they enable TPM 2.0 and Secure Boot.As for Battlefield 6? EA's shooter has suffered numerous leaks throughout 2025, and now, just three days before launch, the game itself may have leaked its way into the publicâ€™s hands, too.Vikki Blake is a reporter for IGN, as well as a critic, columnist, and consultant with 15+ years experience working with some of the world's biggest gaming sites and publications. She's also a Guardian, Spartan, Silent Hillian, Legend, and perpetually High Chaos. Find her at BlueSky. Related reads:Battlefield 6 Global Release Times Confirmed

title: Robin Williamsâ€™ Daughter Takes Stand Against AI Slop Exploiting Her Fatherâ€™s Image
body_text: Zelda Williams, daughter of Robin Williams and the director of 2024 horror comedy Lisa Frankenstein, has issued a firm ultimatum for fans to stop sending her AI-generated videos featuring her father.â€œPlease, just stop sending me AI videos of Dad,â€ wrote Williams in a message posted via Instagram. â€œStop believing I wanna see it or that Iâ€™ll understand, I donâ€™t and I wonâ€™t. If youâ€™re just trying to troll me, Iâ€™ve seen way worse, Iâ€™ll restrict and move on. But please, if youâ€™ve got any decency, just stop doing this to him and to me, to everyone even, full stop. Itâ€™s dumb, itâ€™s a waste of time and energy, and believe me, itâ€™s not what heâ€™d want.â€Willams is adamant in her disgust for AI-generated content and the culture around it.â€œTo watch the legacies of real people be condensed down to â€˜this vaguely looks and sounds like them so thatâ€™s enoughâ€™, just so other people can churn out horrible TikTok slop puppeteering them is maddening,â€ her statement explained. â€œYouâ€™re not making art, youâ€™re making disgusting, over-processed hotdogs out of the lives of human beings, out of the history of art and music, and then shoving them down someone elseâ€™s throat hoping theyâ€™ll give you a little thumbs up and like it. Gross.â€â€œAnd for the love of everything, stop calling it â€˜the future,â€™ AI is just badly recycling and regurgitating the past to be reconsumed. You are taking in the Human Centipede of content, and from the very, very end of the line, all while the folks at the front laugh and laugh, consume and consume.â€Williamsâ€™ new comments echo concerns she raised previously in 2023 about the use of AI to emulate the voices of actors who cannot consent to it. â€œIâ€™ve witnessed for years how many people want to train these models to create/recreate actors who cannot consent, like Dad,â€ she wrote at the time. â€œThis isnâ€™t theoretical, it is very, very real.â€Williamsâ€™ comments came in support of the Screen Actors Guild's (SAG) fight against AI.Robin Williams died in August 2014. The Academy Award-winning actor and comedy icon was 63.Luke is a Senior Editor on the IGN reviews team. You can track him down on Bluesky @mrlukereilly to ask him things about stuff.

title: World of Warcraft Leads Say the Worldsoul Saga Will Eventually Address the Sword of Sargeras: 'Metzen Promised and Metzen Doesn't Lie'
body_text: Related reads:World of Warcraft is getting two major changes in Midnight that are already dividing the community There's an elephant in the room in every discussion of World of Warcraft's upcoming expansion, Midnight. Or should I say, a sword. A really, really big sword.I'm talking about the Sword of Sargeras, an absolutely colossal weapon bigger than a mountain that Sargeras stabbed into the planet several expansions ago and has since just been sitting there, unaddressed, probably doing something awful to the planet.For years now, WoW fans have been asking if we were ever going to, you know, do something about that. And Blizzard has been very, very coy when asked. But answers are coming, says game director Ion Hazzikostas, if not in Midnight, then at least by the end of the Worldsoul Saga.As a recap, the Sword of Sargeras is the sword of, well, the Titan Sargeras, which he stabbed directly into the planet at the end of WoW's Legion expansion as he's being kicked out of Azeroth. Initially, it's poisoning the planet, but players use their Legion Artifact weapons to suck out the poison and buy the planet time before the sword does...something to it. Though the sword was discussed further in the following expansion, Battle for Azeroth, it's since been largely forgotten from a plot standpoint. Instead, it's just...sitting there in the middle of Silithus.And really, I can't emphasize enough, this thing is huge. You can see it from several zones away! Doesn't anyone think this is a problem?At BlizzCon 2023, when the Worldsoul Saga was announced, there was a brief moment of joy that Blizzard might finally pull the sword from the planet, or at least do something with it. There was an enormous statue of the sword in the convention hall, complete with the meme-ified "What sword?" caption. Hazzikostas even wore a shirt emblazoned with "What Sword?". At the time, Warcraft executive creative director Chris Metzen confirmed that we would see the resolution of the Sword Problem in the final piece of the trilogy, The Last Titan.But The Last Titan can't come soon enough, and The War Within and everything we've seen of Midnight so far remain notably sword-less. So in a conversation with Hazzikostas and WoW lead UX designer Crash Reed, I asked them about the sword. What's the deal? Will we finally do something about it in Midnight?"What sword?" both of them intoned in response, simultaneous and predictable. I laughed. Yeah, okay. I deserved that.But Hazzikostas did go on. We will do something about it. "Before the Worldsoul Saga is over. Metzen promised and Metzen doesn't lie."So hang in there, everyone. Just like, the rest of this expansion, all of the next one, and presumably all or most of The Last TItan left to go.For our impressions of all the bits of Midnight we've seen so far, sans add-ons, check out our preview of the new expansion. You can also read more from the same interview with Hazzikostas and Reed, specifically their response to the changes around WoW add-ons in Midnight. Rebekah Valentine is a senior reporter for IGN. You can find her posting on BlueSky @duckvalentine.bsky.social. Got a story tip? Send it to rvalentine@ign.com. Related reads:Housing brings the world back into World of Warcraft - WoW: Midnight Preview

title: Assassin's Creed Mirage's Saudi-Backed Valley of Memory Expansion Looks a Generous Free Side-Quest â€” Though Not One Many Fans Would Have Asked For
body_text: Related reads:Assassin's Creed Mirage: Valley of Memories Screenshots and Concept Art Ask a fan if they want to see more of Assassin's Creed Mirage hero Basim, and you'll likely get a resounding yes in response. One of the most intriguing characters in the franchise's recent history, Basim already ranks among the few of its hooded heroes to appear in multiple games â€” in 2020's Valhalla as a central figure, and then in 2023's Mirage which featured a younger version of the character as its star. The fate of Basim post-Valhalla remains a signficant hanging plot thread, while fans have also yearned to see more of the character between the events of the two games (such as his meeting with Valhalla character Sigurd in Constantinople, centuries before Ezio visited the city). But Ubisoft seems uninterested in entertaining either scenario while cooking up new Basim content, instead working on a new story chapter without any extra lore for the Hidden Ones, and anything that might impact the series' modern day.Five years on from his first introduction, Basim's story will continue in Valley of Memory, a side-story set within the events of Mirage itself. Launching for free on November 18, the expansion will see Basim visit AlUla, now a UNESCO World Heritage site in modern day Saudi Arabia. Why an excursion to what is now Saudi Arabia? And why for free? It's hard to imagine any Assassin's Creed fan reading this not drawing their own conclusions, following multiple reports which have discussed the expansion's funding by Saudia Arabia's controversial Public Investment Fund, which has invested in a growing array of video game companies, and last week formed part of the $55 billion deal that will see EA go private.Publicly, Ubisoft has shied away from discussing the expansion's funding, though previously told IGN that it had retained complete creative control over Valley of Memory's content. Internally, however, Ubisoft has reportedly responded to concerns from developers by drawing a distinction between Saudia Arabia's ruler Prince Mohammed bin Salman and the PIF itself, whose chair is also Prince Mohammed bin Salman.To hear Ubisoft tell it, AlUla was simply a location Mirage's team wanted to explore. "AlUla has always impressed us and was considered for the main game instead of Baghdad," producer Vincent Maulandi-Rabbione said during a recent presentation to press, attended by IGN. "We had access to experts, resources, archeologists, while maintaining a complete creative freedom on how we would create the content."Certainly, AlUla seems to fit visually with the Assassin's Creed series' sense of exploration and parkour. The site features thousands of years worth of history for players to learn about, and geographically it's only as distant from Baghdad as Mirage's existing sequences set within the Assassin fortress of Alamut. But while the concept of AlUla may have existed on a whiteboard within Bordeaux during Mirage's original development years ago, art director Florian Salomez told IGN that no actual work on the region began until Valley of Memory's development began last year. Discussing the content's main concept, Salomez said the expansion's narrative added "a new piece to Basim's coming of age story, and why he chooses the path that ultimately define him." (Oddly, it will also be Bordeaux's second Assassin's Creed add-on about a protagonist searching for a long-lost parent in as many months, following its work leading Assassin's Creed Shadows expansion Claws of Awaji.)"Before his final mission in Baghdad, and before the series of events that lead to the end of the game, Basim hears about his long-lost father Is'haq," creative director Olivier Leonardi said. "[He] is mentioned in the game many times, and he's even mentioned in Valhalla. We know he abandoned Basim as a child aged 7. Now, Basim hears Is'haq may still be alive in the wondrous valley of AlUla. It's so important to him, that he goes on this long journey to get answers."Valley of Shadow sounds subtantial, which makes its addition for free all the more surprising. Ubisoft estimates it contains around six hours of new gameplay spread across a new in-game region with five districts. Familiar Mirage mission types are back, alongside new missions where you chase down stolen goods and gain opportunities to learn about AlUla itself. Alongside all of that, the Valley of Memory update will add several improvements to the main Mirage experience, not least an impressive-looking challenge mode that lets you replay missions from both the new expansion and the main Mirage campaign with additional objectives, which feels a lot like the franchise's classic 'Full Sychronization' rewards. There's a reward track to unlock additional in-game items by testing your prowess here, and you'll be aided by additional game-wide tool upgrades that allow, for example, smoke bombs to now dissolve bodies, or blow darts to pierce armor. As a free gift to fans, Valley of Memory feels generous â€” even if its setting and choice of storyline are not something fans asked for. Tom Phillips is IGN's News Editor. You can reach Tom at tom_phillips@ign.com or find him on Bluesky @tomphillipseg.bsky.social Related reads:Assassin's Creed Mirage Getting Free Saudi Arabia DLC Later This Year

title: Crimson Desert Is This Monthâ€™s IGN First, Check Out 11 Minutes of New Quest Gameplay
body_text: Related reads:Crimson Desert Delayed to 2026 Due to 'Unavoidable' Issues Scheduling Voiceovers, Console Certification, And 'Other Launch Preparations' The wild and expansive open-world adventure, Crimson Desert, is the focus of Octoberâ€™s IGN First. As is tradition, weâ€™re kicking off a month of exclusive content with a brand new gameplay video. Above, you can watch a playthrough of The Captured Fortress, one of Crimson Desertâ€™s faction quests, in which you help Duke Wells retake his castle from rebel forces. This 11 minute-long video showcases a number of Crimson Desertâ€™s key features. First and foremost, of course, is combat. Ever since we first played Crimson Desert at Gamescom 2024, weâ€™ve known that developer Pearl Abyss has been assembling something special when it comes to battle, and here you can see protagonist Kliff making use of a wide array of abilities. Among our favourites is using a spear to pole-vault into an enemy, and the incredibly powerful, magically-charged heavy attacks. But this demonstration mission covers more than just combat. Youâ€™ll also see how Kliff can explore the environment using magic leaps, a Spider-Man-like swing, and his Crow Wings ability, which allows him to glide through the skies towards far-off objectives. Youâ€™ll also see him using his sword to reflect light, a skill that highlights points of interest in the world and guides you towards interesting discoveries. By following the shining lights, Kliff is able to infiltrate the Dukeâ€™s captured fortress in a more stealthy mannerâ€¦ and discover some extra loot along the way, too. Of course, a Crimson Desert showcase wouldnâ€™t be complete without a boss battle, and so this video concludes with a full, violent clash against Fortain, the Cursed Knight. This armour-clad bad lad wields a sword with a mighty, supernatural ability that you donâ€™t want to miss. You might even be able to claim it for yourselfâ€¦And remember, this video is just the first drop. Throughout the month of October, IGN First will take you on a journey into the world of Crimson Desert. Youâ€™ll get to see many more bosses, regions, combat abilities, and two or three exciting new things youâ€™d never guess would be part of a medieval fantasy game. For all that, stay tuned to IGN over the next few weeks.Matt Purslow is IGN's Executive Editor of Features. Related reads:Crimson Desert: 11 Minutes of Brand New Gameplay - IGN First

title: Har producent efterladt instruktÃ¸r pÃ¥ perronen?
author: Af Frederik Hoff og Claus Christensen
body_text: Du er her: Artikler | Nyhed | Har producent efterladt instruktÃ¸r pÃ¥ perronen? RSS-feed / artikler Nyhed 07. okt. 2025 | 07:31 - Opdateret 07. okt. 2025 | 09:21 Har producent efterladt instruktÃ¸r pÃ¥ perronen? Foto | Beo Starling Producenten Amalie Lyngbo Quist har fortalt, at hendes primÃ¦re fokus har vÃ¦ret at lave en sÃ¥ god film som muligt for de midler, hun har fÃ¥et af blandt andre Det Danske Filminstitut. Christina Rosendahl og Nikolaj Arcel mener, at producenten har ansvaret for konflikten mellem instruktÃ¸r Christian Holten Bonke og skuespilleren Dar Salim, som kaster skygger over Herkules falder. Af Frederik Hoff og Claus Christensen Alle involverede i en bitter strid om Herkules falder har givet udtryk for, at filmens skildring af behandlingen af krigsveteraner bÃ¸r fylde mere op til premieren 20. november end konflikten mellem instruktÃ¸ren Christian Holten Bonke og hovedrolleindehaver Dar Salim. Alligevel er debatten fortsat over weekenden pÃ¥ sociale medier, og bÃ¸lgerne gÃ¥r hÃ¸jt. Annonce Kort opsummeret gÃ¥r sagen ud pÃ¥, at debutanten Bonke har anklaget Dar Salim for krÃ¦nkelser. Skuespilleren skal have truet sig til en kreditering som medinstruktÃ¸r og deltagelse i klipningen. Heroverfor stÃ¥r Dar Salim og producenten Amalie Lyngbo Quist fra det lille selskab Beo Starling, der er medejet af Peter Hyldahl. Salim og Quist fortÃ¦ller, at Salim blev bedt om at hjÃ¦lpe med instruktionen â€“ isÃ¦r af veteranerne, der spiller sig selv i filmen. Det skyldtes â€“ hÃ¦vder Salim og Quist â€“ en usikker instruktÃ¸r, som havde pÃ¥taget sig en stor opgave. DÃ¥rligt arbejdsmiljÃ¸ Problemerne startede allerede under de fÃ¸rste dage af optagelserne i august 2024, men blev til en konflikt efter klipningen, hvor Dar Salim nu Ã¸nskede at blive krediteret som medinstruktÃ¸r frem for â€medinstruktÃ¸r pÃ¥ setâ€. Christian Holten Bonke accepterede fÃ¸rst kravet, men efter rÃ¥dgivning hos Danske FilminstruktÃ¸rer sprang han fra aftalen og anklagede i stedet Dar Salim for â€kontinuerligt at nedbryde ham psykiskâ€. Mailen var sendt til producenten, som videresendte den til Dar Salim, der blev chokeret over de alvorlige beskyldninger. For at blive renset valgte han i sidste uge at stÃ¥ frem i Weekendavisen, hvor han blev bakket op af Amalie Lyngbo Quist, som pure afviste anklagerne om dÃ¥rligt arbejdsmiljÃ¸. Det er usÃ¦dvanligt, at en producent offentligt tager afstand fra sin instruktÃ¸r inden premieren. Dar Salim fÃ¥r ogsÃ¥ en varmhjertet stÃ¸tte fra filmens krigsveteraner, som Ekstra Bladet har talt med. Christian Holten Bonke og hans fagforening Danske FilminstruktÃ¸rer har hidtil stÃ¥et alene i konflikten. Men pÃ¥ Facebook argumenterer flere instruktÃ¸rkolleger for, at ansvaret for konflikten ligger et andet sted. Mediemaskinen buldrer Christina Rosendahl (Fuld af kÃ¦rlighed, Vores mand i Amerika) skriver, at hun undrer sig over, â€at journalisterne, bortset fra Ekko, ikke har forstÃ¥et, at det er producenten, de skal interessere sig forâ€. Hun refererer til Ekkos interview med Amalie Lyngbo Quist om hendes ansvar for situationen. â€Producenten er arbejdsgiver for bÃ¥de skuespillere og instruktÃ¸r, og det er desuden producentens juridiske ansvar at sikre et godt psyko-socialt arbejdsmiljÃ¸,â€ fortsÃ¦tter Rosendahl. Hun mener, at det er normalt at vÃ¦re usikker som debuterende spillefilminstruktÃ¸r, hvilket producenten kunne have grebet ved eksempelvis at benytte en erfaren instruktÃ¸rassistent. Christina Rosendahl hÃ¦fter sig ogsÃ¥ ved, at producenten til Ekko siger, at hun fÃ¸rst opdagede Christian Holten Bonkes utilfredshed under klipningen i oktober 2024, men at Dar Salim jo allerede blev medinstruktÃ¸r pÃ¥ set under optagelserne i begyndelsen af august 2024. â€Og jeg bliver isÃ¦r trist over at producenten tilsyneladende har forladt sin instruktÃ¸r pÃ¥ perronen, hvor mediemaskinen buldrer lÃ¸s,â€ fortsÃ¦tter hun. Burde ikke vÃ¦lge side Opslaget har fÃ¥et filmbranchen til tasterne, og producenten Rikke Tambo skriver, at Rosendahl bÃ¸r passe pÃ¥ med at udtale sig sÃ¥ konkret om en sag, hun ikke kender indgÃ¥ende, og komme med antagelser pÃ¥ producerens vegne. InstruktÃ¸ren Nikolaj Arcel (Bastarden, En kongelig affÃ¦re) mener derimod, at Christian Holten Bonke er blevet ladt i stikken. â€I sÃ¥dan en ubehagelig konflikt er det slet, slet ikke i orden at vÃ¦lge side som producent pÃ¥ en film,â€ skriver han. Amalie Lyngbo Quist svarer under opslaget, at hun forstÃ¥r det pres, Christian Holten Bonke som debutant har vÃ¦ret under. Netop pÃ¥ grund af hans manglende erfaring med fiktion var det svÃ¦rt at fÃ¥ de syv millioner kroner i stÃ¸tte fra Filminstituttet. NÃ¥r det lykkedes, var det ikke mindst, fordi Dar Salim sagde ja til at spille hovedrollen. â€Christian Holten Bonke blev tilbudt en teknisk instruktÃ¸r, inden budgettet blev lukket, men Ã¸nskede det ikke. Da vi opdagede, hvor stort presset var pÃ¥ optagelserne, fandt vi i enighed pÃ¥ den lÃ¸sning, at Dar Salim kunne blive medinstruktÃ¸r pÃ¥ set,â€ skriver Amalie Lyngbo Quist. Producenten understreger, at Bonke var ansat i sit eget selskab Bonke Film, hvorfor hun ikke har et arbejdsgiver-ansvar for ham. â€Producentforeningen har lavet en undersÃ¸gelse blandt en stor del af filmens afdelingsledere, og ingen har oplevet en grÃ¦nseoverskridende adfÃ¦rd fra Dar Salims side,â€ fortsÃ¦tter producenten. Men fastslÃ¥r samtidig, at hun gerne deltager i en uvildig undersÃ¸gelse pÃ¥ tvÃ¦rs af Producentforeningen, Danske FilminstruktÃ¸rer og Dansk Skuespillerforbund. Staldtips InstruktÃ¸ren Birgitte StÃ¦rmose (Camino, Darling) skriver i sit eget Facebook-opslag, at Dar Salim ikke kan forvente en instruktÃ¸rkreditering for at komme med staldtips til filmens veteraner. â€Man er ikke instruktÃ¸r blot, fordi man hjÃ¦lper med at coache sine mindre erfarne medspillere. Den slags staldtips bÃ¸r ikke honoreres med en instruktÃ¸rkreditering,â€ mener hun og fortsÃ¦tter: â€InstruktÃ¸ropgaven er sÃ¥ meget stÃ¸rre end det og rÃ¦kker langt ud over det, som foregÃ¥r pÃ¥ et filmset. Alle Ã¥rene op til, at man stÃ¥r pÃ¥ optagelser, og hele visionen for filmen â€“ det er dÃ©t, som instruktÃ¸ren primÃ¦rt krediteres for.â€ Christian Holten Bonke har skrevet manuskriptet til Herkules falder sammen med Marianne Lentz. Over for Ekko har han fortalt, at han allerede fik idÃ©en for knap ni Ã¥r siden. Birgitte StÃ¦rmose, der har erfaring fra Afterwar, hvor flere virkelige personer spiller sig selv, fortÃ¦ller i opslaget, at det er almindeligt at ansÃ¦tte en coach. Det kan vÃ¦re en hjÃ¦lp ved vanskelige instruktÃ¸ropgaver. Men hun understreger, at en coach ikke er en instruktÃ¸r. â€Jeg oplever, nÃ¥r jeg lÃ¦ser de forskellige artikler, at Dar Salim har forsÃ¸gt at trÃ¦de lÃ¦ngere ind pÃ¥ instruktÃ¸rens domÃ¦ne, end han burde have gjort. Og jeg tÃ¦nker: Hvorfor har producenten ikke stoppet det? Hvorfor har producenten ikke beskyttet instruktÃ¸ren som bÃ¦rer af filmens vision?â€ Altid loyalt samarbejde Dar Salim har ogsÃ¥ kommenteret sagen pÃ¥ sin Facebook-side med et opslag i fredags. Han skriver, at det var producenten, som bad ham overtage en del af instruktionen. Det var med andre ord ikke noget, han pressede sig til. Han hÃ¦vder ligeledes, at krediteringen ikke gjorde nogen forskel for ham. â€Den diskussion, som kort opstod, efter filmen var fÃ¦rdig, handlede kun om at finde en lÃ¸sning, der kunne hjÃ¦lpe Christian i en svÃ¦r situation,â€ skriver han og tilfÃ¸jer, at henvendelsen fra Danske FilminstruktÃ¸rer Ã¦ndrede alt. â€Det kom til at handle om integritet â€“ og om at stÃ¥ fast, ogsÃ¥ i en ulige kamp mod et magtfuldt forbund, selv om det i sidste ende er mit levebrÃ¸d og mit navn, der stÃ¥r pÃ¥ spil.â€ Dar Salim mener, at hans historik taler for sig. Han har altid haft et godt samarbejde pÃ¥ alle de produktioner, han har vÃ¦ret en del af. â€Jeg har i over tyve Ã¥r vÃ¦ret en del af massevis af produktioner, altid med et godt og loyalt samarbejde med instruktÃ¸rer, kolleger og hold,â€ lyder det fra skuespilleren, der er kendt for Underverden og The Covenant. â€Der er ingen grund til, at jeg netop pÃ¥ Christian Bonkes fÃ¸rste forsÃ¸g pÃ¥ et filmset skulle opfÃ¸re mig anderledes.â€ Herkules falder vises eksklusivt for krigveteraner i KÃ¸benhavn, Aarhus og Odense onsdag den 8. oktober. Dar Salim er en del af panelet i KÃ¸benhavn, mens man kan mÃ¸de Christian Holten Bonke i Aarhus. title: InstruktÃ¸r reagerer pÃ¥ ballade med Dar Salim
author: Af Claus Christensen
body_text: Du er her: Artikler | Nyhed | InstruktÃ¸r reagerer pÃ¥ ballade med Dar Salim RSS-feed / artikler Nyhed 03. okt. 2025 | 12:49 InstruktÃ¸r reagerer pÃ¥ ballade med Dar Salim Foto | Andreas Bastiansen Christian Holten Bonke har i mange Ã¥r vÃ¦ret dokumentarist, men fik idÃ©en til fiktionsspillefimlen Herkules falder for snart ni Ã¥r siden. Christian Holten Bonke Ã¦rgrer sig over, at striden med skuespilleren Dar Salim er i fÃ¦rd med at overskygge hans kommende film om traumatiserede krigsveteraner. Af Claus Christensen Herkules falder har fÃ¸rst premiere 20. november, men den er kommet ud i et vÃ¦rre stormvejr, efter at Weekendavisen i onsdags offentliggjorde en artikel om en intern strid. Striden stÃ¥r mellem debutinstruktÃ¸ren Christian Holten Bonke og filmens hovedrolleindehaveren Dar Salim. Skuespilleren har hjulpet med instruktionen, og det var aftalt, at han skulle krediteres med den usÃ¦dvanlige titel: medinstruktÃ¸r pÃ¥ set. Annonce Men efter ogsÃ¥ at have bidraget til klipningen af filmen Ã¸nskede Dar Salim at blive krediteret som medinstruktÃ¸r af hele filmen. Det sagde Christian Holten Bonke fÃ¸rst ja til, men kort efter trak han det tilbage igennem sin fagforening Danske FilminstruktÃ¸rer. I marts sendte Danske FilminstruktÃ¸rers chefjurist en mail til filmens producent, Amalie Lyngbo Quist fra Beo Starling, med anklager om, at Dar Salim havde udsat instruktÃ¸ren for trusler og psykiske krÃ¦nkelser. Det chokerede skuespilleren, og da Weekendavisen fik nys om sagen og af en kilde havde fÃ¥et tilsendt alt materiale i sagen, valgte Dar Salim at tage bladet for munden. Han mener ikke, at instruktÃ¸ren havde de nÃ¸dvendige fÃ¦rdigheder, der skulle til for at instruere filmen. Samtidig afviser skuespilleren, at han pÃ¥ nogen mÃ¥de skulle have vÃ¦ret grÃ¦nseoverskridende. Dar Salim bakkes op af flere af de medvirkende i filmen samt producenten. â€Dar kom med en kÃ¦mpe erfaring, og det var en stor opgave for Christian som debuterende spillefilminstruktÃ¸r, opdagede vi, inklusive ham selv,â€ siger Amalie Lyngbo Quist til Ekko. Forrygende prÃ¦station Christian Holten Bonke udtalte sig kort i Weekendavisens artikel, men for fÃ¸rste gang udtaler han sig nu efter, at historien er kommet ud. â€Jeg synes, at det er Ã¦rgerligt, at dette spektakel er i fÃ¦rd med at overskygge filmens vigtige budskab,â€ skriver han i en mail til Ekko og fortsÃ¦tter: â€Jeg er vildt stolt over filmen, der for fÃ¸rste gang satte sig som et lille frÃ¸ i mit sind for snart ni Ã¥r siden, da min kÃ¦reste og jeg gik tur med vores tre uger gamle baby.â€ â€Pludselig blev vi bevidste om, at en mand, der nÃ¦rmest var gÃ¥et i Ã©t med naturen, lÃ¥ og beskuede os. Jeg talte senere med nogle lokale, der fortalte, at det vat en krigsveteran, der levede pÃ¥ kanten af civilisationen.â€ â€For fem Ã¥r siden tog jeg for alvor emnet op, og det har vÃ¦ret en Ã¸jenÃ¥bnende indsigt i et stort samfundsmÃ¦ssigt problem, som jeg med denne film virkelig hÃ¥ber kan sÃ¦tte en meget vigtig samtale i gang om, hvilken virkelighed vi tilbyder vores tidligere udsendte soldater.â€ InstruktÃ¸ren nÃ¦vner ogsÃ¥ Dar Salim. â€Jeg skrev hovedrollen til Dar, da jeg tÃ¦nkte, at han ville have noget kÃ¸rende med karakteren. Det havde han i den grad, og han leverer en fuldstÃ¦ndigt forrygende skuespilprÃ¦station som veteranen Youssef.â€ â€Jeg glÃ¦der mig til, at min fÃ¸rste spillefilm fÃ¥r premiere her 20. november, og jeg vil hellere end gerne tale om den og det vigtige emne, den berÃ¸rer,â€ slutter han sin mail og tilfÃ¸jer: â€Dermed har jeg ikke flere kommentarer (til sagen, red.).â€ Trailer: Herkules falder Kommentarer christian holten bonke, dar salim, herkules falder tilmeld nyhedsbrev Dit navn: Din email: Hvad er 1 + 2? title: Voldsom strid om Dar Salim-film
author: Af Frederik Hoff og Claus Christensen
body_text: Du er her: Artikler | Nyhed | Voldsom strid om Dar Salim-film RSS-feed / artikler Nyhed 02. okt. 2025 | 22:59 - Opdateret 03. okt. 2025 | 16:09 Voldsom strid om Dar Salim-film Foto | Beo Starling IfÃ¸lge Dar Salim er rollen som traumatiseret ekssoldat i Herkules falder hans bedste prÃ¦station, men nu er han havnet i et bittert opgÃ¸r med instruktÃ¸ren og hans fagforening. Spillefilmdebutanten Christian Holten Bonke anklager hovedrolleindehaveren i Herkules falder for at true sig til en bedre kreditering, mens Dar Salim mener, at Bonke forsÃ¸ger at dÃ¦kke over sin egen inkompetence. Af Frederik Hoff og Claus Christensen 5. september bragte Ekko en artikel om traileren til den kommende film Herkules falder. Dar Salim spiller hovedrollen som ekssoldaten, der kÃ¦mper med traumer og identitetsforvirring pÃ¥ et veterancenter pÃ¥ StrynÃ¸. Filmen fÃ¥r premiere 20. november og er den fÃ¸rste fiktionsfilm instrueret af dokumentaristen Christian Holten Bonke. Den har et budget pÃ¥ tretten millioner kroner, heraf ti millioner fra Det Danske Filminstitut og FilmFyn. Annonce Da traileren blev sendt ud, fremgik det ogsÃ¥ af pressemeddelelsen, at Dar Salim havde deltaget i instruktionen som â€medinstruktÃ¸r pÃ¥ setâ€ â€“ en usÃ¦dvanlig titel, der mÃ¥tte betyde, at Dar Salim havde deltaget i instruktÃ¸rarbejdet pÃ¥ optagelserne, men ikke i forarbejdet og klipningen. Netop Dar Salims kreditering har vist sig at vÃ¦re genstand for en dramatisk konflikt mellem skuespilleren og Christian Holten Bonke. Uenighed om krediteringer er almindeligt i filmbranchen, men sjÃ¦ldent en pressesag, fordi alle parter ved, at sÃ¥danne konflikter i sidste ende skader filmen. Det er imidlertid prÃ¦cis, hvad der er sket for Herkules falder. Blot halvanden mÃ¥ned inden premieren er filmen endt i et sandt clusterfuck, og det ironiske er, at den efter sigende er blevet temmelig vellykket. I gÃ¥r kunne Weekendavisen nemlig afslÃ¸re, at instruktÃ¸ren igennem fagforeningen Danske FilminstruktÃ¸rer har anklaget Dar Salim for at nedbryde ham psykisk og bruge trusler og afpresning til at tilkÃ¦mpe sig en bedre kreditering. Salim afviser anklagerne over for Weekendavisen og beskylder til gengÃ¦ld Bonke for at konstruere en krÃ¦nkelsessag. Skuespilleren mener, at han fik en stÃ¸rre ledelsesrolle som resultat af Bonkes manglende styring med produktionen. Weekendavisens kilder fra optagelserne i august 2024 â€“ inklusive af lederne af det virkelige veterancenter, hvor filmen er optaget, Anne-Line Ussing â€“ bakker op om Dar Salims oplevelse og afviser, at Salim skal have opfÃ¸rt sig dÃ¥rligt under produktionen. TÃ¥get proces 52-Ã¥rige Christian Holten Bonke blev uddannet tv-producer fra Den Danske Filmskolen i 2005. Ekko udgav pÃ¥ dvd #26 hans dansefilm Ballroom Dancer (2011), der blev udtaget til flere festivaler og fik en speciel mention i Tribeca. Han stÃ¥r desuden bag portrÃ¦tfilm om Uffe ElbÃ¦k (Uffes alternativ) og forfatteren Jakob Ejersbo (Ejersbo) og var instruktÃ¸rassistent pÃ¥ Afdeling Q-spillefilmen Marco effekten. Men det har Ã¥benbart ikke vÃ¦ret nok forberedelse til at stÃ¥ i spidsen for en spillefilm. Bonke skrev manuskriptet til Herkules falder sammen med Marianne Lentz, men i en mail, som Weekendavisen har set, erkender han, at instruktÃ¸rarbejdet var vanskeligt. Specielt undervurderede han opgaven med personinstruktion. Virkelige veteraner og ledere af StrynÃ¸-centret er en del af castet, og ifÃ¸lge en af veteranerne kom Salim til at stÃ¥ for instruktionen af dem. Efter nogle dage Ã¸nskede Dar Salim at fÃ¥ en kreditering, og der blev fundet den usÃ¦dvanlige lÃ¸sning at kreditere ham som â€medinstruktÃ¸r pÃ¥ setâ€. Salim afviser over for Ekko at skulle have truet med at forlade produktionen, og skuespilleren mener, at der var en sÃ¦rdeles god stemning pÃ¥ produktionen. IfÃ¸lge Weekendavisen opstod problemerne da ogsÃ¥ fÃ¸rst under klipningen, hvor Dar Salim sendte noter til instruktÃ¸ren og klipperen Denniz GÃ¶l Bertelsen â€“ ifÃ¸lge Salim pÃ¥ opfordring fra bÃ¥de instruktÃ¸ren og producenten. Det er i sig selv atypisk, at en skuespiller fÃ¥r lov at blande sig sÃ¥ meget i klipningen. Men ifÃ¸lge Weekendavisen ender det med, at Salim fÃ¥r stor indflydelse â€“ ogsÃ¥ pÃ¥ Ã¦ndringen af slutningen. En af de involverede skriver en mail om, at der mangler kommunikation fra bÃ¥de producenten og instruktÃ¸ren i en tÃ¥get proces, hvor alle mister tilliden til hinanden. Ydmyget offentligt Dar Salim bliver ikke betalt for sit ekstraarbejde, og derfor skriver han 5. marts en mail til Christian Holten Bonke. Han beder om en krediteringsmÃ¦ssig anerkendelse af sin rolle i filmens tilblivelse og anfÃ¦gter Bonkes instruktÃ¸revner. â€Din forestilling om, hvad det vil sige at lave en film, fortÃ¦lle en historie og at instruere stemte ikke overens med virkeligheden og de fÃ¦rdigheder og evner, det krÃ¦ver. Ikke engang tÃ¦t pÃ¥,â€ skriver skuespilleren ifÃ¸lge Weekendavisen. InstruktÃ¸ren accepterer fÃ¸rst at kalde filmen â€en film af Christian Holten Bonke og Dar Salimâ€, men Danske FilminstruktÃ¸rers chefjurist skriver senere pÃ¥ mÃ¥neden til producenten, at aftalen er droppet. IfÃ¸lge Weekendavisen mener juristen, at Salim via sin stjernestatus â€har kunnet true en debuterende fiktionsinstruktÃ¸r til at fÃ¥ instruktionskrediteringer ved kontinuerligt at nedbryde ham psykiskâ€. Salim skal have truet med at ydmyge Bonke offentligt og nÃ¦gte at mÃ¸de op til ekstraindspilninger af lyd, hvis han ikke fik det, som han Ã¸nskede. Chefjuristen skriver, at Salim ogsÃ¥ truede sig ind i klipperummet. Danske FilminstruktÃ¸rer indleder derfor en sag om dÃ¥rligt psykisk arbejdsmiljÃ¸ mod filmens producent Beo Starling, der er ejet halvt af Amalie Lyngbo Quist og halvt af Beofilm ved Peter Hyldahl. Fagforeningen opfordrer til en undersÃ¸gelse af arbejdsmiljÃ¸et pÃ¥ produktionen, og Dansk Skuespillerforbund har hyret en ekstern advokat, der arbejder pÃ¥ en undersÃ¸gelse. Dansk Skuespillerforbund, Producentforeningen og Danske FilminstruktÃ¸rer har afholdt flere mÃ¸der om sagen, men uden at kunne lÃ¸se konflikten, som dermed har udviklet sig til en stÃ¸rre skala. Chokeret over mailDar Salim siger til Ekko, at krediteringen ikke lÃ¦ngere havde nogen betydning for ham, da han kom i besiddelse af mailen fra Danske FilminstruktÃ¸rer. Han blev chokeret over anklagen om psykisk krÃ¦nkelse. Men striden er ikke blevet bilagt, og der har pÃ¥ det seneste vÃ¦ret en konflikt om stÃ¸rrelsen pÃ¥ instruktÃ¸ren og hovedrolleindehaverens navn pÃ¥ plakaten. Dar Salim mener dog ikke, at den hÃ¥rde formulering i hans mail til Bonke er retvisende for resten af hans dialog med instruktÃ¸ren. Og han er selv meget stolt af Herkules falder. â€Det er efter min mening den bedste film, jeg har medvirket i, og jeg glÃ¦der mig til at dele den med publikum. Veteranernes historie er stÃ¦rk, rÃ¸rende og relevant. Den nÃ¦gtede jeg at smide pÃ¥ gulvet. Hvis jeg stod i situationen igen, ville jeg gÃ¸re prÃ¦cis det samme Ã©n gang til â€“ uden at Ã¦ndre noget som helst.â€ GrÃ¦nseoverskridende adfÃ¦rd Ekko har forsÃ¸gt at fÃ¥ en kommentar fra Christian Holten Bonke, som ikke er vendt tilbage. Til Weekendavisen skriver han, at han stÃ¥r ved sin oplevelse. â€Meget fÃ¥ har haft indsigt i, hvordan mit samarbejde med Dar Salim reelt har vÃ¦ret bag kulisserne,â€ skriver han, men roser ogsÃ¥ Salim for en â€sublim prÃ¦stationâ€ i hovedrollen samt hans engagement pÃ¥ settet. â€Jeg har absolut ingen interesse i at fjerne fokus fra veteransagen, for mÃ¥let med filmen er at bidrage til en samtale om veteraners vilkÃ¥r i Danmark, og det hÃ¥ber jeg virkelig, at vi lykkes med,â€ fortsÃ¦tter han. I dag har Danske FilminstruktÃ¸rer valgt at orientere sine medlemmer om sagen i en mail. â€Som instruktÃ¸r, og isÃ¦r som debuterende, stÃ¥r man ofte meget sÃ¥rbar og alene, og er i meget hÃ¸j grad afhÃ¦ngig af opbakning fra de stÃ¦rke kreative krÃ¦fter, man har med sig. IsÃ¦r fra sin hovedrolleindehaver,â€ skriver forperson SÃ¸ren Balle og tilfÃ¸jer. â€NÃ¥r et medlem fortÃ¦ller os, at han oplever grÃ¦nseoverskridende adfÃ¦rd, bliver vi nÃ¸dt til at tage det meget alvorligt.â€ Foreningen kritiserer ogsÃ¥, at en part i sagen, Dar Salim, udtaler sig til pressen. â€Til stor skade for de involverede og i sidste ende ogsÃ¥ filmen og filmens fokusomrÃ¥de. Nemlig, at vi som samfund ikke har Ã¸je for vores krigsveteraner.â€ Danske FilminstruktÃ¸rer Ã¸nsker stadig en uafhÃ¦ngig arbejdsmiljÃ¸undersÃ¸gelse af produktionen. Sker det ikke, vil man selv tage initiativ til en undersÃ¸gelse. Producentens prioritet Amalie Lyngbo Quist fra Beo Starling har som arbejdsgiver ansvaret for at sÃ¸rge for, at alle er trygge pÃ¥ produktionen. Men hun mener ikke, at hun har svigtet sin uerfarne instruktÃ¸r til fordel for stjernen Dar Salim. â€Jeg genkender ikke, at der skulle have vÃ¦ret et ubehageligt arbejdsmiljÃ¸ pÃ¥ nogen mÃ¥de. Jeg har talt med og indhentet skriftlige vidneudsagn fra holdet i forbindelse med, at sagen opstod, og ingen udtaler, at de har oplevet det ubehageligt pÃ¥ optagelserne.â€ â€“ GÃ¦lder det ogsÃ¥ klippeprocessen? â€Det har vÃ¦ret pÃ¥ en positiv mÃ¥de, at Dar har bidraget i klipningen, og han har leveret et stort kunstnerisk bidrag til den fÃ¦rdige film.â€ â€“ Har du og Beo Starling vÃ¦ret gode nok til at styre produktionen? â€Som producent er min fornemste opgave at fÃ¥ Filminstituttets investering og de private investeringer til at blive til en sÃ¥ god film som muligt. Den her film er blevet rigtigt god, det er vi utroligt mange, der er enige om. BÃ¥de det store veteranmiljÃ¸, biograferne og Filminstituttet. Generelt er opfattelsen, at filmen er virkelig vellykket.â€ â€“ Folk pÃ¥ produktionen skal vel ogsÃ¥ have det godt undervejs? â€Ja, selvfÃ¸lgelig skal de det. Det var vigtigt for bÃ¥de Christian og mig, at veteranerne fÃ¸lte sig i gode hÃ¦nder under optagelserne. Dar kom med en kÃ¦mpe erfaring, og det var en stor opgave for Christian som debuterende spillefilminstruktÃ¸r, opdagede vi, inklusive ham selv. Derfor var vi enige om at gÃ¸re Dar til medinstruktÃ¸r pÃ¥ set. Det gjorde, at veteranerne og de Ã¸vrige medvirkende fÃ¸lte sig i gode hÃ¦nder.â€ â€“ Oplevede du selv, at Christian var usikker, og at det var en stor opgave for ham? â€Ja, det gik da op for os undervejs.â€ â€“ HvornÃ¥r fandt du ud af, at Christian havde det dÃ¥rligt? â€Han skrev det til mig i oktober 2024, mens vi var i klippeprocessen. Jeg talte sammen med hans reprÃ¦sentant i Danske FilminstruktÃ¸rer, som ikke foreslog nogle tiltag overhovedet.â€ Fanget i principiel sag Til Ekko skriver Dar Salim i en mail, at Danske FilminstruktÃ¸rers mail til sine medlemmer i dag, hvor foreningen kaldet det â€dybt problematisk, at der er blevet lÃ¦kket dokumenter, og en part i sagen har valgt at udtale sig til pressenâ€, er symptomatisk. â€Jeg er ikke afsender pÃ¥ Weekendavisens artikel. Jeg bliver kontaktet og udtaler mig selvfÃ¸lgelig, for jeg er blive anklaget for noget skÃ¸rt og har ikke noget at skjule. Avisen har alle dokumenter og ikke bare et udvalg. Danske FilminstruktÃ¸rers eget medlem, producenten og reprÃ¦sentanten for de medvirkende veteraner udtaler sig alle i artiklen,â€ skriver skuespilleren. â€Alle med forstand pÃ¥ medier ved, at jeg intet har at vinde ved at blive associeret med sÃ¥dan en sag i pressen, uagtet at alle anklager er 100 procent falske.â€ â€“ Er det ikke atypisk, at en skuespiller bliver sÃ¥ aktiv en del af klipningen? â€Jo, og jeg holdt mig i starten helt ude af processen. Men det blev nÃ¸dvendigt, at jeg kom ind, og det skete efter aftale med bÃ¥de Christian og producenten. FÃ¸rst sendte jeg blot noter til det fÃ¸rste gennemklip, som jeg var blevet bedt om.â€ â€Senere blev vi enige om, at jeg skulle komme i klipperummet af flere omgange â€“ altid sammen med klipperen, Christian og ofte ogsÃ¥ producenten. Det var konstruktive, kreative samtaler i en god og kollegial tone, og det er ogsÃ¥ skriftligt bekrÃ¦ftet af bÃ¥de klipper og producent.â€ â€PÃ¥ et tidspunkt ringer klipperen selv og fortÃ¦ller, at han har aftalt med Christian, at vi bare kunne tage dialogen direkte. Det gjorde vi sÃ¥ frem til, at jeg lukkede filmen sidste nat, og vi fik en takkemail fra Christian nÃ¦ste dag.â€ â€“ Hvad kan vi lÃ¦re af den her sag? â€I filmbranchen lÃ¸ser vi altid problemerne, uanset hvad de er. Vi holder sammen. Det gjorde vi ogsÃ¥ her. Alle slog ring om Christian Holten Bonke, hjalp til og kÃ¸rte i extra hÃ¸je omdrejninger. Og vi lykkedes jo.â€ â€Balladen opstÃ¥r fÃ¸rst, efter vi har afsluttet arbejdet og ogsÃ¥ var blevet enige om kreditering. Det er egentlig ligegyldigt, for alle pÃ¥ filmholdet ved, hvem der har gjort hvad. Vi skulle bare finde en mÃ¥de at sige â€™tak for hjÃ¦lpenâ€™ pÃ¥ og stÃ¥ sammen udadtil.â€ â€Jeg forsÃ¸gte selv i en mail, som var meget direkte og Ã¦rlig. Og det virkede. Vi blev enige. Indtil Danske FilminstruktÃ¸rer blev involveret. Mindre end et dÃ¸gn senere dukker det famÃ¸se brev op, fyldt med de udokumenterede anklager og trusler mod bÃ¥de producenten og min person, hvor jeg bliver benÃ¦vnt som â€™stjerneskuespillerâ€™.â€ â€“ Men det er vel Danske FilminstruktÃ¸rers pligt at skride ind, hvis et medlem har lidt psykisk overlast? â€Ja, jeg er helt enig med forperson SÃ¸ren Balle i, at hvis nogen fÃ¸ler sig krÃ¦nket, skal det tages alvorligt. Det gÃ¸r man ved at undersÃ¸ge, hvad der er sket â€“ grundigt og professionelt. Og give den bistand, som vedkommende har brug for, hvis han eller hun har slÃ¥et sig.â€ â€Man gÃ¸r det ikke ved at sende udokumenterede anklager mod en kollega, der loyalt har hjulpet. Og slet ikke ved stÃ¦digt at fastholde dem i syv mÃ¥neder, pÃ¥ trods af samtlige andre involverede beskriver en anden virkelighed.â€ â€Jeg oplever, at vi alle er blevet fanget i en principiel sag, hvor Danske FilminstruktÃ¸rer frygter, at fremtidige debutanter kan risikere at skulle afgive rettigheder til andre faggrupper. Jeg har fuld forstÃ¥else for den bekymring og Ã¸nsker ikke at rokke en centimeter ved instruktÃ¸rernes rettigheder. Hvis sagen var blevet hÃ¥ndteret professionelt og kollegialt, havde vi fundet en lÃ¸sning.â€ Ekko har forelagt kritikken for Sandra Piras, sekretariatschef i Danske FilminstruktÃ¸rer, men foreningen Ã¸nsker ikke at sagsbehandle i offentligheden. title: DR fyrer Sandy French
author: Af Frederik Hoff
body_text: Du er her: Artikler | Nyhed | DR fyrer Sandy French RSS-feed / artikler Nyhed 01. okt. 2025 | 15:15 DR fyrer Sandy French Foto | Agnete Schlichtkrull Sandy French har siddet pÃ¥ posten som nyhedsdirektÃ¸r hos DR siden 2017, men nu skal der nye krÃ¦fter til. NyhedsdirektÃ¸ren afskediges i forbindelse med organisatoriske Ã¦ndringer og afslÃ¸ringen af et omfattende taxa-forbrug samme Ã¥r, som hun mÃ¸dte kritik for en omdiskuteret GrÃ¸nlands-dokumentar. Af Frederik Hoff I februar tog DRâ€™s nyhedsdirektÃ¸r Sandy French den radikale beslutning at afpublicere dokumentaren GrÃ¸nlandss hvide guld efter massiv kritik fra blandt andre hÃ¸jtstÃ¥ende politikere. Samtidig fyrede hun den ansvarlige chefredaktÃ¸r for DR Nyheder, Thomas Falbe. Men hun blev ogsÃ¥ selv udsat for kritik for hÃ¥ndteringen af sagen. Annonce Af en pressemeddelelse fra DR i dag fremgÃ¥r det, at Sandy French nu selv er blevet afskediget i forbindelse med den nytiltrÃ¥dte generaldirektÃ¸r Bjarne Corydons visioner for public service-stationen. â€Hendes fratrÃ¦den sker pÃ¥ et tidspunkt, hvor DR gennemfÃ¸rer de fÃ¸rste organisatoriske Ã¦ndringer, som skal understÃ¸tte DRâ€™s arbejde med implementering af en kommende ny strategi,â€ udtaler Bjarne Corydon i meddelelsen. Han roser French for imponerende resultater, hÃ¸j faglighed, lederkompetencer og et strategisk overblik i sine otte Ã¥r pÃ¥ posten. Det er dog nok mest i den diplomatiske genre, da Corydon vil afbryde samarbejdet. Det oplyses ogsÃ¥, at den undersÃ¸gelse Sandy Frenchâ€™ taxa-forbrug, der blev igangsat i august, nu er afsluttet. UndersÃ¸gelsen kom i stand, fordi Frihedsbrevet afslÃ¸rede, at nyhedsdirektÃ¸ren fra januar 2020 til januar 2025 havde kÃ¸rt taxa mindst 521 gange. IfÃ¸lge French pÃ¥ grund en sprÃ¦ngt akillessene og diskusprolaps. UndersÃ¸gelsen konkluderer, at 50-Ã¥rige Sandy French har brugt DRâ€™s taxakort pÃ¥ en mÃ¥de, der ikke er i overensstemmelse med stationens retningslinjer. Hun har tilbudt at betale de cirka 16.000 kroner tilbage. â€DR har ikke grund til at tro, at Sandy French har handlet forsÃ¦tligt. Det Ã¦ndrer imidlertid ikke ved, at forholdet har indgÃ¥et i DRâ€™s samlede vurdering og beslutning om at afslutte samarbejdet nu,â€ stÃ¥r der i undersÃ¸gelsen. Nye krÃ¦fter Stillingen som nyhedsdirektÃ¸r â€“ og en nyoprettet stilling som teknologidirektÃ¸r â€“ vil ifÃ¸lge DRâ€™s pressemeddelelse blive slÃ¥et op snart. Frem til ansÃ¦ttelsen vil redaktionschef Kirsten Marie Svendsen overtage Sandy Frenchs ansvarsomrÃ¥de. â€Jeg er bÃ¥de taknemmelig og stolt over mine otte Ã¥r som nyhedsdirektÃ¸r i DR. Jeg har fÃ¥et lov til at arbejde sammen med de dygtigste medarbejdere og chefer og det har vÃ¦ret meningsfuldt, udfordrende og motiverende hver eneste dag,â€ udtaler hun i meddelelsen. â€At nye krÃ¦fter skal til, er et vilkÃ¥r pÃ¥ det her niveau, og jeg videregiver trygt DR Nyheder til min efterfÃ¸lger. Jeg har stor respekt for Bjarne Corydon og hans projekt med at sikre DRâ€™s position i fremtiden. Public service er vigtigere end nogensinde, og jeg Ã¸nsker ham alt det bedste med den betroede opgave.â€ Kommentarer bjarne corydon, sandy french tilmeld nyhedsbrev Dit navn: Din email: Hvad er 1 + 2? title: Elon Musk Promises His xAI Studio Will Release a 'Great' AI-Generated Video Game and Grok Will Make a Movie That Is 'At Least Watchable' Both Before the End of 2026
body_text: Related reads:Cult of Blood, a Retro-Inspired Survival Horror Game, Officially Announced for PC, Xbox, and PS5 Elon Musk has made a series of ambitious predictions about his AI tech and its ability to create video games and movies, although there is a healthy dose of scepticism online around the claims.In a tweet, the Tesla owner said his xAI game studio will use Grok to release a â€œgreatâ€ AI-generated game before the end of next year. The statement was part of a QT of a video showing a rudimentary Call of Duty-style first-person shooter.The XAI game studio will release a great AI-generated game before the end of next year https://t.co/F14rJXNzk9â€” Elon Musk (@elonmusk) October 6, 2025 Indeed, xAI has an open position for a â€˜Video Games Tutorâ€™ who will, for $45/hour - $100/hour, train Grok to produce â€œengaging, fun, innovative video games, enabling users to explore AI-assisted game design and fostering advancements in interactive entertainment through accurate annotations and iterative testing.â€The question of generative AIâ€™s impact on video games is perhaps the hottest topic within the industry. In June, Epic Games boss Tim Sweeney predicted that small teams will soon be able to use AI prompts to make video games on the scale of Nintendo masterpiece The Legend of Zelda: Breath of the Wild.Speaking to IGN at Epicâ€™s State of Unreal 2025 event (where CD Projekt revealed a stunning The Witcher 4 tech demo), Sweeney said AI prompts will be â€œa fundamental partâ€ of game engines, and will result in â€œentirely new genres of games invented that weren't possible or practical beforeâ€ without it.But Larian Studios' publishing director Michael "Cromwelp" Douse responded to Muskâ€™s claim to insist that AI â€œisn't going to solve the big problem of the industry, which is leadership and vision.â€â€œGenuinely what this industry needs is not more mathematically produced, psychologically trained gameplay loops, rather more expressions of worlds that folks are engaged with, or want to engage with,â€ Douse said. â€œAI has its place as a tool, but we have all the tools in the world and they aren't compensating for the incredible lack of cogent direction.â€Douse continued: â€œThere simply is no resonance without mutual respect. There is no mutual respect without respect for craft. There is no craft without the human touch; the relative skill issue, or 'the exhibition of otherness.' To turn games into digital, emotionless content is to abandon all resonance... which is why people play!â€Musk is of course infamous for making broken promises, not just around Tesla, SpaceX, and his Cybertruck, but societal progress in general. â€œMy predictions about achieving full self-driving have been optimistic in the past,â€ Musk admitted to investors in 2023. â€œIâ€™m the boy who cried FSD." Earlier this year he claimed robots will number in the tens of billions and be like â€œyour own personal C-3PO or R2-D2, but even better.â€But his predictions for Grok didnâ€™t stop with video games. In a more recent tweet, Musk claimed Grok will make a movie that is â€œat least watchable before the end of next year and really good movies in 2027.â€ That statement came as part of a QT of a six-second video showing generic Hollywood action. Grok will make a movie that is at least watchable before the end of next year and really good movies in 2027 https://t.co/5Fy42WRFLMâ€” Elon Musk (@elonmusk) October 6, 2025 Like with video games, generative AI is the hot topic in the movie industry. Last week, SAG-AFTRA issued a strongly worded statement in response to the emergence of Tilly Norwood, the AI-generated â€œactressâ€ that had enraged Hollywood. The backlash online has been vociferous, and it remains to be seen if Tilly Norwood actually goes anywhere.And then thereâ€™s the very real danger of copyright infringement associated with the use of generative AI. Over the weekend, OpenAI vowed to give copyright holders â€œmore granular controlâ€ over character generation after its Sora 2 app produced a flood of videos that depicted copyrighted characters â€” including those owned by Nintendo.Indeed, Musk himself has had problems of his own with this issue. Last year, posts on Twitter containing images of Nintendoâ€™s iconic mascot generated by Grok were pulled offline due to takedown notices.Meanwhile, Disney and Universal have sued the AI image creator Midjourney, alleging that the company improperly used and distributed AI-generated characters from their movies. Disney also sent a cease and desist letter to Character.AI, warning the startup to stop using its copyrighted characters without authorization.â€œA lot of the videos that people are going to generate of these cartoon characters are going to infringe copyright,â€ Mark Lemley, a professor at Stanford Law School, told CNBC. â€œOpenAI is opening itself up to quite a lot of copyright lawsuits by doing this.â€Photo by VINCENT FEURAY/Hans Lucas/AFP via Getty Images.Wesley is Director, News at IGN. Find him on Twitter at @wyp100. You can reach Wesley at wesley_yinpoole@ign.com or confidentially at wyp100@proton.me. Related reads:Burger King Says It Ditched 'Creepy King' Because He Was Scaring Off Families With Kids â€” Who Walked Straight Into McDonald's Instead

title: 'You Can't Control Box Office Results' â€” Dwayne 'The Rock' Johnson Responds to The Smashing Machine's Disappointing Launch
body_text: Related reads:The Smashing Machine Review Dwayne 'The Rock' Johnson has issued a statement after The Smashing Machine became the Hollywood star's worst box office opening ever.Johnsonâ€™s Oscar contender The Smashing Machine flopped hard upon its launch last week. A24â€™s new movie, which sees Johnson transformed in the role of legendary mixed martial arts and UFC fighter Mark Kerr, made just $6 million at the domestic box office. Thatâ€™s a career low opening for the WWE star, whose 2010 thriller Faster made $8.5 million, not adjusted for inflation.According to Variety, A24 has something of a disaster on its hands here, as it reportedly spent $50 million to produce the movie â€œand many millions more on promotional efforts.â€In an Instagram post, Johnson thanked fans who had turned out to watch The Smashing Machine, but insisted â€œyou canâ€™t control box office results.â€ Instead, Johnson said, he was in control of his performance, which he remains proud of.Hereâ€™s Johnsonâ€™s statement in full:From deep in my grateful bones, thank you to everyone who has watched The Smashing Machine.In our storytelling world, you canâ€™t control box office results â€” but what I realized you can control is your performance, and your commitment to completely disappear and go elsewhere. And I will always run to that opportunity.It was my honor to transform in this role for my director Benny Safdie @bowedtie. Thank you brother for believing in me.Truth is this film has changed my life.With deep gratitude, respect and radical empathy,djAhead of The Smashing Machineâ€™s release, Johnson had said he was â€œpigeon-holedâ€ as an actor who could only appear in blockbusters, which is one of the reasons he wanted to star as Mark Kerr in the movie.While promoting the movie at the Venice Film Festival, the former wrestling star said he wanted to "live my dreams now" after "living other people's dreams."Johnson kicked off his hugely successful acting career as The Scorpion King in 2001â€™s The Mummy Returns. His long list of blockbuster film roles include Lucas "Luke" Hobbs in the Fast & Furious franchise, Dr. Xander "Smolder" Bravestone in the Jumaniji reboot movies, and Black Adam in the now defunct DC Extended Universe. Johnson also famously voiced Maui in the Moana animated movies, and is set to play the character in Disney's upcoming live-action version.The Smashing Machine, however, marks a significant change for Johnson, who some are saying could be in-line for his first Oscar nomination as a result. As reported by the BBC, the 53-year-old said: "I've been scared to go deep and intense and raw until now, until I had this opportunity to do this."He continued: "I have wanted this for a long time. When you're in Hollywood, as we all know, it had become about box office and you chase the box office. And the box office in our business is very loud, it can be very [overwhelming]."It can push you into a corner and category â€” 'This is your lane, this is what you do, and this is what people want you to be and this is what Hollywood wants you to be.â€™"And I understood that, and I made those movies and I liked them and they were fun, and some were really good and did well, and some not so good!"But I think what I did realise is I just had this burning desire and this voice that was just saying, 'What if there's more, what if I can?'"Sometimes it's hard to know what you're capable of when you've been pigeon-holed into something. It's harder to know, 'Wait, can I do that? I feel like I can.â€™ And sometimes it takes people who you love and respect to say 'you can.â€™"Johnson added: "I have been very fortunate to have the career I've had over the years and make the films that I've made. But there was this voice inside of me that said, 'What if I could do more?'"The truth is, I looked around a few years ago and started to think, 'Am I living my dream or am I living other people's dreams?'"And you come to that recognition and you can either fall in line, go, 'It's status quo, things are good,â€™ or you can go, 'No, I wanna live my dreams now and do what I want to do, and tap into the things I want to tap into and have a place to put all this stuff that I've experienced in the past that I've shied away from.â€™"IGN's The Smashing Machine review returned a 7/10. We said: "The Smashing Machine punches hard for the most part, but stops short of a knockout."Wesley is Director, News at IGN. Find him on Twitter at @wyp100. You can reach Wesley at wesley_yinpoole@ign.com or confidentially at wyp100@proton.me. Related reads:The Smashing Machine Debut Trailer Reveals First Look at Dwayne 'The Rock' Johnson in UFC Action

title: P3-vÃ¦rt Helin Erdem debuterer pÃ¥ scenen i â€˜GRWMâ€™ â€“ og udleverer mediebranchen og sig selv
